So after changing out to this cable, no more brief disconnect problems. My big screen TVs catch all the football action now without bleeping out. The picture is top quality, too.

I bought (2) 35-foot AmazonBasics HDMI cables and neither worked.  Tried 2 monitors and tried 3 different sources.  Both the sources and monitors could tell there was some type of signal, but no connection.  Returning these and purchasing CNE71511 instead, because I've purchased their 50 foot HDMI cable before that worked great.https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00TB3Q2KO/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Worked for my PS4 pro.  Was having constant issues with my PS4 randomly going to a black screen once I started using a longer HDMI cable.  I used to think that all HDMI cables were the same since it's a digital signal.  Apparently not true and you need a faster cable for 4k HDR.  This works great!

Used this on my second monitor.  After about a month the screen started blacking out.  I have to shake the cable to make it come back on.  His has been going on for over a year.  Finally, I bought one from the store .. problem solved.Spend you money on a good quality cable  done buy this junk.

These HDMI cables are awsome! The first movie I tested them with Alien. I only sampled the opening scenes, the passover of the ship has details that I never paid that much attention to. The inside of the ship hallways are dark & moody. But when lit the light the details sharpen. In the computer interface room the lights have the same effect also the flickering lights don't seem to break up. I tested this movie for this reason. But when in the hyproberic chamber the room is so bright you can truly see detai lin John Hurt's body. Face & shoulders. I watched the first 30 minutes of Titanic 3-D which has the same effect & the 3-D just adds to it. Over all, darn good cables!

I was happy with this purchase, although the cable gave out and stopped functioning after about 8 months of heavy (i.e. daily) use.  Typically I used the cord between my laptop and a television screen, either at work or at home.  After 8 months or so, the connection at one end could no longer be maintained.  Once the laptop moved slightly, the connection was broken (a lot like what often happens with headphones with frequent use).  I will probably buy again, since it worked for a long time in heavy usage.

I bought this to watch NJPW and Hulu on my TV by inelegantly running an HDMI cable from my living room TV along the wall to my couch where I plug it into my laptop. It's a standard 25 foot HDMI cable and hasn't given me any problems whatsoever. But It's a digital cable that adheres to the standard. Not sure what else to say in the review. Bit thick, but again, 25 feet; kinda has to be.

I thought this might be a flimsy version of the more expensive HDMI cords, but I was mistaken. Not only is this cord longer than most standard HDMI cords. It's also very durable compared to other brands of HDMI cords. I will only buy this brand of HDMI cords in the future. By far the best HDMI cord I've ever used.

We travel a bit and rarely have wifi access. We use our phones to stream video to a TV through cable. We bought the 25' so we could have our phones closer than our 12' cable allows. First, it's about twice the dia as the 12' and very stiff. Not a deal breaker, but the dark picture is. The 25' has a noticeably darker pic than the 12' with either phone. We tried both ios and android phones with their respective adaptors. Both have the same pic quality. It's usable for shows shot on lighted sets, but for dimly lit night scenes it's pretty bad.

I didn’t put an Stars for picture quality for sound quality cause to be honest...I’ve never see an hdmi cord actually make a difference in either haha. I got the 25ft one. And I over compensated hahaha. I needed it to reach our couch to plug into an adapter then into the Macbook. It’s way to long. The cord itself is thick and feels strong. It’s still bendable though. It’s feels like it’s strong and will last a while. The HDMI plug at the end is, well, and HDMI plug. It looks like any other. It gets the job done. It has some weight to it when you hold the whole cord rolled up. It is 25ft though. I definitely recommend this HDMI cord to anyone who needs one. Fairly priced and seems of good quality!!

Would not function for all applications.  Specifically the one intended for, extend the security camera output to monitor in another room.  It did appear to provide output for a laptop to the monitor, but with a darker image.Another hdmi cable worked fine for the security camera output, albeit a shorter one.  To extend the video ended up downgrading to a vga run that is working fine to display the image.

This cable isn't built to the highest standards or anything like that but when it's sitting behind your A/V equipment and almost never touched or seen it doesn't need to be.The important thing is that these cables are fully HDMI 2.0 compliant with their 18Gbps and 4K60Hz support.

Please do not waste your hard earned money on overpriced HDMI cables in the name of picture or sound improvements. I currently am using these AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI cables to connect our Yamaha v379 AV receiver to other HDMI enabled devices that link back to our 4K Samsung Smart TV and these have performed flawlessly.HDMI cables come in four types: Standard-speed --> Standard-speed with Ethernet --> High-speed --> High-speed with Ethernet. Since High-speed cables are so cheap (e.g these AmazonBasics cables), there really isn't any point of getting Standard-speed anymore. On the other hand, as most HDMI devices today can't receive Ethernet over HDMI, High-speed HDMI cables are really all you need.

I got this cable for the single purpose to hook my Nvidia Shield 4k to my Samsung TV. After looking at multiple different options, i kinda figured 'what the hell' when it came to the amazon basics, it pretty much matched the competition on materials and specs, excluding one offer that had a braided cable... which in this purpose given i won't be moving the cable often, seemed to be kinda pointless.As expected the cable did its job wonderfully and i have no complaints when it comes to it! I would easily recommend this to a friend just looking for a cable to get especially for the price and the fact the delivery was super speedy.

A word of caution for these cables.When I need new HDMI cables I don't even blink - I just order them from Amazon. In a general upgrade, I got a new 4K UHD HDR television, Apple TV 4K, a UHD Blu-Ray player, a brand new Denon Receiver, and the new Comcast Xfinity XG1v4-a box that does 4k60.

Worked well for a short time but like most things made today is cheaply made inside and I find that it shorts occasionally causing me to mess with the plug-in part. Maybe I just got one that was made by a lazy worker? It happens... maybe a design flaw though. All in all I don't think that throwing more money at another one would necessarily mean that it is made any better as most companies today want to use the cheapest materials put together by the most inexpensive labor that they can possibly find and it shows.

I literally will never buy another cable other then amazon. Why would you pay four, five, or even six times as much. These cables do the exact same thing as the brand name and last just as long. The amazon cables I feel are a little less stiff, this makes cable management a little easier.I will always buy these HDMI.

I originally bought these because I was burning through HDMI cables left and right. Cheap ones, expensive ones, ones that came with soundbars, or Blu-ray players. All sorts of cables. Keeping that in mind, I have found these to last longer and outperform much more expensive HDMI cables on the market. I have paid as much as $30 for one cable in the past from a big box store, and the cable failed a short time later.Thus far, these cables have been very reliable but if they should fail I feel much better about replacing the two I spent a few dollars on versus the one I spent considerably more on.

Amazing cables at an affordable price. Tested with 4K HDR and Dolby Vision. Works with Apple TV too. I have this HDMI cable going from my Denon AV receiver to my LG OLED TV and all my devices hooked to my AV receiver using this HDMI cable as well. Everything works great. Don't listen to the reviews that said Dolby Vision doesn't work on the Apple TV. They probably didn't set up their AV receiver and TV settings properly. The TV and the AV receiver has a setting that is listed as HDMI Deep Color or HDMI Enhanced that you will need to enable for HDR and Dolby Vision. Also it is prefered to set up the match settings under the video settings for the Apple TV.

I plugged it in and was getting a flickering screen, it was 3 feet away from my PC, so did not eat up the full 10' cord I ordered. Pulled it out, put it on my counter to look at it, inspect it, and the case around the USB fell off it right then and there, either this item was broken and returned and given to me, or it fell apart after one very-gentle use. I do not recommend this item, spend $12 and get yourself a professional, Grade A HDMI cable from a reliable company.

Seriously, Amazon basics is amazing. The price of this cable is rock bottom, and yet it's better than (without exception) every HDMI cable I've owned for less than $70. The fittings are tight, durability has been such a non-issue that this is the first time I've thought about it, and I've had one of these and used it daily for years.I'm using this to connect a Chromebook to monitors. That means this cable travels with me a LOT, and gets unplugged and plugged back in at both ends a LOT, into a bunch of different kinds of displays. And, surprise, it's as good now as the day I bought it even though it gets soooo. Much. Use!

After a couple of months of usage, I just found out that these cables doesn't work when I'm playing old games. I have Windows 10 and in order to play older pc games, the display usually has to be switched to compatible mode (less color depth and less resolution), but I'm getting a black screen from these cables, and I couldn't even shut off my monitor due to this. I'll have to unplug and power cord and plug it back in to get the monitor to display normally again.I have tried both cables in the package and both have a same behavior. This is bad.

I loved the fact that they are high speed cables for such a reasonable price.  Admittedly I have a more technical audio visual setup than most people.  My audio visual rack is about 70 feet away from the living room all run through HDMI baluns.  So this may be contributing to the sensitivity of my set up...I started getting sparkles and lines through the picture only when using the new Apple 4K TV not the cable box or blue ray player.  My old Apple TV didn't do this.  I tried several settings to get these picture defects to go away but the only thing that has worked is to reduce the output resolution down to 720p.  It looks as though the Amazon basic cables don't have the bandwidth for the new Apple 4K TV.

Simple and straightforward cable design.  I've used the same cable to connect my MacBook Pro to a Samsung 4K smart TV, as well as a custom built Windows computer tower to a Dell monitor, and it worked flawlessly in both situations.  This is in fact my second purchase of the same product, as I don't want to have to juggle the same single cable between the two different aforementioned applications.  I highly recommend this product.

I bought this cable for use with my Xbox One during a remodeling project in which I wanted to keep the old cable routed behind the old television while using this cable to connect the console to a new TV.  I was initially a bit nervous to buy a budget option rather than paying a little more, but I'm quite pleased with this purchase.  It works just as well as any of the other cables I've used.  At a fraction of the price of many of those cables, this provides great value.  Highly recommended.

Went to a thrift store, saw some used old HDMI cables, they were selling for more expensive than this. Went to Walmart, all they had was one cable for 10 bucks. Screw it. Went to amazon, few clicks and 2 days later, and I got 2 great HDMI cables for cheap. Keeps my 3 monitor setup going. Went and bought some more as backup HDMI cables too, just in case since I have a bunch of other devices I need to hook up in the future to my TV.

I've bought several previous versions of this cable in the past. The build quality was great, they were thoughtfully designed and lasted me a really long time.This new version is a different story entirely. In their ongoing war on cost-cutting Amazon decided to use a rougher, poorer quality plastic which means the ports on either end of the cable are wider and thicker than normal. If you're using a Macbook Pro or any other laptop with ports spaced closely together this new design prevents you from charging and using an external display at the same time.

I really like Amazon Basics products.  In general I find them to be reliable and I'm more comfortable buying an Amazon branded product than a product from an unknown manufacturer.  I realize that all of these things are made in a factory probably somewhere in Shenzhen, China, but I have come to believe that Amazon doesn't put its name on things that are junky.  There is no point in spending a lot of money for an HDMI cable but there is a good case to be made for replacing older cables with newer versions.  This year I replaced all of my HDMI cables with High Speed cables and this pair was an excellent value.

I needed a HDMI Cable to connect my Laptop with my TV, and I wanted the best  deal possible for the price, therefore I went with this one ( specially because this was from Amazon, I wanted to give it a try). I ordered 2 at once,  I have just use one of the two  I purchase and so far the quality on the TV is as if I was using the TV itself. Excellent Quality in the image (HD), theres not  delay in the signal, and my TV and laptop detected the cable right away.So far a Highly recommended product :D

Using both cords, this one and the one that came with the product, neither one was better than the other - so I don't get why the price is so high.The product(s) arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped without issue, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials.

This cable didn't work for my purpose. I needed to duplicate my PC screen onto another PC or the TV.  But, this cable didn't do that.  I did get another cable that worked - Tainston Flat High Speed HDMI Cable (50 Feet) Support 4K 2160P,3D,1080P,Audio Return Channel.  I didn't know enough to get the right type of cable the first time.  Just looked for HDMI, but, apparently there are different versions of that cable.

Pretty basic and pretty good both at the same time.I bought this one to hook up my Apple tv to Samsung 55 inch smart tv I watch directvnow on my tv through apple tv and all the channels that are actually transmitting HD quality picture is in fact what I am able to watch through this hdmi cable with almost no deterioration in picture quality which is what I expected from this cable and makes me very happyAs I still have to hook up my PS4 and Chromebox, I might buy a couple more of these bad boys as they do job nicely and they do look like they are long standing as the material seems pretty sturdy, overall pretty happy with it and will recommend it to anyone looking for a good quality HDMI cable.
Not HDR compatible. Works fine for anything less than HDR.My Playstation Pro when outputting HDR with this cable does not work on the TV. Everything else such as 1080, yes. With My 4K LG tv.

These flake out intermittently on my Apple TV 4k. I often will get pink hued screen or other artifacts causing me to have to restart the unit. I returned these but Amazon said just keep them and refunded me (probably since they are junk anyway). They do work most of the time and I have been too lazy to find a reliable replacement since I don't watch much TV. I use it with the Apple TV 4k and a Vizio P series display (if that is important)

Don't fall for the crap sales people say in order to sell you an overpriced cable. This does the job perfectly. I just it to hook my Nvidia Shield TV box into my TV for some crispy 4K content. Does the job perfectly with no issues whatsoever. Great and reasonable price makes it that much better.You should go with more expensive brands of you need more length but if it's just going a few feet end to end... Don't waste your money and just get a cable that works without giving you that just ripped off feeling. Hi Speed, 4K @60HZ without a stutter. Plus I like that it is low profile, making cable management a breeze.

Cable seems to work well and is well built. Two issues that bother me is 1) cable thickness and 2) connector she'll size.1) Could be good or bad depending on your needs, but I needed to run this through a narrow channel. The cable is 3x as thick as the one I'm replacing which made things much more difficult.

I get it, it's my fault I didn't think about how thick this cable would need to be to cover 25 feet.  It's not terrible; if you need a product with this length, it works fine.  We had our Nintendo Switch dock hooked up from behind the couch, running this wire under the rug and under the couch.  We've moved recently and don't need the length anymore, and this is the only HDMI cable I own that I think I will dispose of now.  It's just too large to practically use for anything else.

This cable caused me so much grief!!! I got a new soundbar and had issues getting 4k + HDR + Atmos working from my Xbox one S to make it to my TV. Ended up upgrading to a Xbox one x for the holidays to fix my issues and they were even worse! I had been bugging Samsung (soundbar) along with Microsoft (Xbox) for months! Finally swapped out this cable to a monoprice 8k cable and everything works now!!!This cable cannot handle too much thrown it's way! I agree, you don't need to spend a ton on an HDMI cable BUT you need one that can handle enough bandwidth!!

I was making changes to my home entertainment center, and just couldn't justify expensive cables.The ones I had before, had this stiff plastic mesch on the outside.  They were so stiff, they'd either pop out of the receiver or device.  I threw them in the garbage once I got these.

With the shelter in place order, I've been setting up my twins to use the tv as their screen for their online classes. We've been using our iPad for this and I wanted extra length on the HDMI to allow the iPad to be further away from the tv. I didn't want to buy an Apple TV, so this has worked out brilliantly at a fraction of the price. My 2nd graders love being able to do their work together (normally they are in separate classes) and it gets them off their tiny screens!

I purchased this 10 foot cord to attach my son’s Xbox game system to his TV. I ran the cord inside the wall for a clean look. The quality of the cord is apparent. The cord is thick, yet pliable enough to run inside a wall with no issues. It attaches to the TV fine and bends enough to be concealed behind the TV set. The game system works fine, and picture is very good. Two 10 foot cords for $10 is a great deal. I would not hesitate to purchase these again. I recommend these hdmi cords.

HDMI is digital, it either works or it doesn't, there's no difference in quality between different brands or with special 'golden' bs or anything like that.  Really glad Amazon offers a reasonably priced reliable cord when you need one.  Btw - bringing an extra along on trips has become a no brainer for us - nothing like turning any hotel TV into a system playing whatever you want from your laptop streaming account.Thanks!

Needed this cable to run through my drop ceiling in my basement from my receiver's SUB out port to another TV in my basement bar.  Now my theater TV and my bar TV are in perfect sync with the sound system so when watching sports, you can view either TV synced to the same sound source.  35' cable was perfect length, good quality cable, just make sure you plug the TV end into the TV and the source into the source.  Seems like a no brainer, but this is not a normal cable where either end works at TV or source.

These not work reliably at 4k 60Hz 4:4:4 chroma with my Apple TV 4K, Onkyo TX-RZ720 &  LG OLED 65B7P. Although others have said 4K/60/4:4:4 works, it doesn't for me. I get random flashes of color and sometimes the whole screen takes on a magenta tint. Maybe quality control is lacking and I got assume bad ones. Who knows. It seems like they work for every other mode though.

This HDMI cable is so long and it fits perfectly with the display port I bought alongside with it. I was able to connect everything together between my MacBook Air 2017, and my boyfriend's AOC monitor. It displayed properly, it just took me a bit to figure out how to navigate in between screens.For MacBook Air's, definitely go into your settings and play around with the functions it has. I was able to figure out how to make everything fit well.

Works great as advertised. Do not fall for sales people that try to say you need some high-quality cables. There is not much difference between these or other cables didn't advertise higher-quality. This has been debunked. There are many YouTube videos about that.

I have been having intermittent problems with my home theater system.  I returned the soundbar to the manufacturer and he stated that everything worked flawlessly. He suggested trying new HDMI Cables. He suggested Monoprice or AmazonBasics. I decided to purchase the AmazonBasics. Its been three weeks with not one issue.  Not one audio drop out no video drop outs, Awesome. Now I hope I didn't jinx myself by writing this review.

I bought a new television that stopped working.  In checking, I realized the end of my HDMI cable was slightly bent.  I found much higher priced cables online, but I took my chance with this cable.  It came quickly, I plugged it in, and the television is back to working perfectly.  Thisvwas such an easy to use, low cost product.  I would give it ten stars if I could.

Bought this based on the thousands of reviews.  I did not expect it to work as well as it did but if I could pull the major local stations then I was going to be fine.The package arrived on time and undamaged and contained all of the equipment needed to mount the antenna within about 8 feet of the TV.  My desired location was a bit further away.  I had to be a cable coupler to connect an additional cable to get the full length.  I also used suction cups with hooks to hang the antenna so it could be easily moved if needed.  As shown in the map there are several broadcast towers but all are a few miles away.  The last picture is the final count of channels found.

I’m not sure why I thought I needed 10ft of HDMI cable.  I purchased this product because of the affordability of essentially getting 2 cables for the price of one.  HDMI cables can be ridiculously expensive for some unknown reason.  These are sturdy cables that work just fine.  I have used them for about 1 year now.  They still look brand new.  I assume if you care for them (don’t kink them or manually impose undue pressure upon them, they will last as long as any more expensive cable.

The price point of these cables made me a little skeptical about quality but I thought I'd give 'em a try. Amazon Basics has always been acceptable for all the other stuff I've purchased so, why not.Using 2 cables with a coupler, I connected a desktop computer to my 55" Roku TV.  I thought with a 50' run there might be some signal loss but to my pleasant surprise, both picture and sound quality are excellent - no complaints whatsoever.
Perfect for all usesIf you have the previous generation 1.4 standard, you might not need the upgrade

This is the thickest cable I've ever owned. I was expecting the girth of a coaxial cable but it well surpasses that. It sounds like a good thing and it very well may be but it seems unnecessarily thick. It made snaking into the "Wiremold CMK50 Cord Mate II Kit" with the power cord considerably more difficult than I anticipated. Nonetheless it eventually did fit...barely. That being said, it's a great cable. Well worth the hassle. I can tell it's going to last me a very long time. Just keep the thickness in mind if you're having to fit it in any tight spaces. *no pun intended*

There is no reason to spend big $$$ for cables.  The cables either meet the specs or they don't.  These meet the specs.  I've used them on multiple devices.  The build quality if good and the results are good.  Many issues with HDMI connections end up being with the socket (female) side of the connection.  They collect dust.  Clean them out with an air blast and many of your problems will disappear along with the dust.

Right out of the box this cable was not reliable. After a few minutes of watching a show it went to black, I lost audio, and the screen of the TV turned blue which I assume it meant to say, "I'm not getting anything." I got the same results from the HBO, Netflix, and Hulu apps. When I switched back to my original cable everything was fine. Worst of all I don't feel comfortable  trying to return it as I was so confident an HDMI cable should just work I had already written "TV" in silver sharpie on both ends of the cable. Buy Monoprice cables instead.

I've ordered these several times and they've always worked flawlessly.Our TV is HD 1920P and these cables do not degrade the picture visibly at all. The connectors are nice and the wire itself is sufficiently large to be rugged and reliable. They plug and unplug easily and they're backed by Amazon. Great packaging, great performance, great value and no need to drive to the local store and shop, they came right to my door and answered my needs.

Had a 70 foot run to connect security NVR to flat-panel monitor. The cable is thick, but not that difficult to work with. Ran through wall, up to and through ceiling and down another wall. This cable replaced a wireless HDMI transceiver system that worked, but experienced occasional reception problems. Those problems are now gone. Running the cable was not easy, but the trade-off was living with wireless transceiver issues.

I purchased this extra HDMI cable to be permanently plugged into my flat screen LED TV. This cable is dedicated to attach the Apple iPad using the Lightning Digital AV Adapter. It is hard to find the HDMI connector on the back of the TV. The extra cable allows me only to have to plug it in once, and not have to unplug any other devices to free up an HDMI cable.

For several years I thought my HDTV picture was just OK.However when a friend suggested I switch out my HDMI cables I purchased these cables and my TV’s picture is now outstanding.  I had thought of upgrading my TV but there is no reason to now.

I wish I had bought a Belkin. After a few months it’s started randomly disconnecting from the TV. It was a pain to set it up. And now I have to move heavy furniture and re run new cables that work. So that I may watch a movie without losing connection 12 times.When reading good reviews. Keep in mind how quickly post purchase the review may have been posted. My issue happened a few months in.

Great cables for a great price! We have tried them with our TV and our laptops (including Macs) and they worked perfectly every time! I can definitely recommend them to anyone (especially for that price). I cannot give specific details about their resolution/graphic abilities (since I don't know anything about this and don't use them "professionally") but they were definitely sufficient for us to watch movies on our TV, for our playstation, and for my husband's work screens.PS. You do get 2 cables and they look EXACTLY like in the picture!

The HDMI cable works fine, but it's absurdly thick. I'd guess twice as thick as most regular HDMI cables. With all that girth it acts like a spring, so if you plug it into a small device (IoT/Raspberry Pi), it wants to uncoil and flip the device. The plastic around the plug is also really thick, so it doesn't easily fit into screens with little clearance room. The video quality is good at 1920x1200. I haven't tested it at higher resolutions.

I have two of these cables: one from December 2015 and one from now (December 2018). I had been using the old one to send sound from my TV to my receiver with HDMI ARC, and it was working perfectly. After I swapped the new one in for the old one, I started getting skips in the audio signal every couple of minutes. If I put the old cable back, the skips stop.The new cable has different connector molding and is noticeably thinner than the old one, so something has clearly changed in the production process. Maybe the new one has less shielding, leading to this issue?

Works exactly as stated. It's very sturdy! The length was perfect.I live in a flat above and in the back of an old building, so I have my blu-ray player up on a sill due to the wi-fi signal that doesn't quite make it to where I have my TV. (The "Add A Photo" button isn't working online or through the app, otherwise I'd show you I'm not a hermit.) The cord seems to help with speed and quality during streaming which is wonderful.

You really need no better HDMI cables then this, buy anything more and it's just fluff money. From the most expensive home theater to a simple cable box/TV, these are perfect. Dont buy into hype and fallacies like you see from "Mnstr Cabl". All you need for HDMI is a solid connection, and the correct format of cable. Read before you buy and save some money!

I purchased a 25' cable and at fist it seemed to work well enough.  Then during a certain movie with a dark scene, I could barely see the picture.  At first I thought it was because the room was too bright.  Later on during the same movie the screen would go blank for 1-2 seconds every 20-30 seconds.  I ejected the disc and wiped it off but the screen was still flashing.  I had never observed this before but began to suspect the cable.  So I moved the DVD player next to the TV with a shorter cable and the problem went away.  I replaced the 25' cable with an Audioquest Pearl cable (I know, expensive) and the dark scene I couldn't see before was perfectly clear and visible even in the bright room.When researching on-line, many articles say cables need to achieve a speed of 18 Gbps.  The Amazon basics cables claim a speed of "up to" 18 Gbps even for the 25' cable.  I don't think they're getting there.  The Audioquest cables say "exceeds" 18 Gbps.  I never would have guessed it but you can tell the difference and it's significant.

First cable I had with Amazon basics lasted a good 3 years or so before it stopped receiving signal to the amplifier. I then noticed today, only after about a month; audio was transmitting, arc would work intermittently but there would be no video. (TV would show no signal for my HTPC or any device connected to the amp-- I could hear audio, but no video, so there is definitely a signal loss somewhere) I'm starting to think there is a issue with quality control with Amazon cables. While I have a lot of devices working fine with them, this is going to be a return and I'm switching brands this time around.

Don't believe what people tell you as these electronic stores want you to buy their overly priced hdmi cables.I have these HDMI cables which were dirt cheap hooked up to my qled Samsung 80 inch 4K TV and also into my 4K DVD player and they work flawlessly. If you want to spend $100 on their special HDMI cord more power to you but all that basically the same you have the word sucker on your forehead.

4 year without any major issues until now, not bad especially at the price we got it for! Purchased this HDMI cable back in June 2016. As of last year, we noticed it started giving out, screen would go black. We would adjust and it would work for a good while until the next time. Now, we have to rig it by placing something to hold the end connection in place so our screen doesn’t go black again. Also, Roku is popping up notices to check the HDMI cable too.I can’t find where to contact Amazon Basics regarding the limited lifetime warranty. Usually there is a “Contact Seller” button but not here. I’m sure I can find a 1-800 number somewhere but it’s not worth the hassle. I didn’t pay a lot for this cable back in 2016 and it served its purpose well while we had it. Not too concerned about getting a replacement. This cable is probable out-dated for today’s standards anyways.

As of May 9th, 2019, the bullet points list the cable as supporting 18Gbps.  Further down, the manufacturer only claims 10.2Gbps.  The packaging and cable markings provide no clue about the actual supported speed.  According to wikipedia (and elsewhere), hdmi cables labeled as "high-speed" support 10.2Gbps, and hdmi cables labeled as "premium high-speed" support 18Gbps.After purchasing, my conclusion was that these are only guaranteed to support 10.2Gbps (4K at 30Hz) and will NOT guarantee 18Gbps (4K at 60 Hz) which is common in hardware nowadays.  The bullet points are false and misleading.  18Gbps may work at smaller lengths but is NOT guaranteed.

I bought this cord to connect my computer to the TV . It is about as thick as my pinky finger and very stiff making it awkward to fit behind the tv when not in use and making it hard to position the computer without the cord pushing the computer around and sometimes putting tension on the hdmi port which causes connection issues as well as not being great for the port long term. the coiled up cord is also about as heavy as my laptop and takes up as much room in a bag, so not great for portability. it is long and seems to work fine other than the connection issues from it being so stiff and hard to position correctly.

I purchased several 10 and 3 foot versions of these cables to connect 8 different game consoles (native HD and up-converted analog) to an 8-port HDMI switch and the switch to a capture device and two TVs using a splitter. I'm not pushing anything more demanding than 1080p60, but these cables handle it without any issues. They connect securely to every device I've tried and have enough girth to them to hold their shape (no kinking) through tight turns.

Great cables. We have 2 of these plugged into outlet strips on either side of the couches in the living room. With our kids and their friends over quite a bit, they are always needed to charge. These are perfect and have held up wonderfully. These are used daily by at least one person and they are long enough that if a kid is sitting in the center of the couch, the cable still reaches them to charge. We also have them in our cars and reach the back seat just fine.

I'am with Spectrum and my cable box would shut off and reset on it's own constantly  on my new 4k tv.  Spectrum came to my house 4 times and checked my service lines and changed my cable box out to no avail.  I thought because my old tv was just hd that maybe my old hdmi cable was causing it so i pursed this cable and since then (3 months) it has not reset even one time.  The cable works great and the quality is there. I would purchase this cable again and from the same vendor.

Yes it works. I got a 25' cable for occasionally sitting on the couch with a laptop and putting content on the tv. The price and length were good. But the cable is absurdly thick, stiff and unwieldy. It's as thick as my outdoor heavy duty extension cords. I would rather pay more and get something thinner and more pliable.

I got two of the 10 foot ones because the six-foot one that I had was no longer working for me it was too far away from the TV. These are great they came quick nice sturdy box.You remember when these HDMI cable for $50 at Best Buy I don’t even know they still maybe. You would buy TV and then they would hit you with that HDMI cord that was 3 feet in some instances not even 6 feet for 50 bucks. Well those days are long gone and of course Amazon was always ahead of the curve when it comes to that.  When I first got a flatscreen TV that did not come with HDMI cable it was a smaller one I bought a $50 cable. That’s when my brother in law told me return it and went to Amazon got it for 10 or $12 back then
+ Long cable+ Fast transmission

There isn't really a need anymore to go to a big box stores and buy expensive HDMI cables when they're available on Amazon. I purchased this cable for a friend for their new 4K TV and WOW! The picture is clean, crisp, beautiful and bright! To test the cable we hooked up a PS4 pro to the TV and popped in a game. The textures, the movement of the camera and dimension was just amazing! I would recommend this cable to anyone looking for a quality HDMI cable that won't break the bank.

I have a Vizio M65-E0 4K HDR TV and an LG UP970 UHD Blu-Ray player, which worked fine with other HDMI cables I had. I bought this AmazonBasics cable (in 10ft length) to replace the existing cable, and when I connected the equipment (the player connected directly to the TV, not going through a receiver) and tried to play a disc I got no picture whatsoever... totally black screen. I then swapped back in the old cable, and it worked perfectly.I have no idea what the cause is... whether these cables are incapable of handling HDR datastreams, or there was some incompatibility with one of the components... but one way or another, this cable did not work at all where another cable worked fine.

A great HDMI cable, especially for the price. I did a lot of research and found that there was no noticeable difference between the very expensive and the cheaper cables. I trust the Amazon basics label and have never been disappointed with anything, this cable included. The picture quality is great, and the cable has been perfect for gaming with a Playstation 4.

Amazon Basic products are usually pretty good.  I don't know that I could tell the difference in performance of a basic vs some kind of "superior" HDMI cable but there is one thing about this product you might need to know.. the insulation makes these really thick.. maybe about double size of other HDMI cables.  If you need to tuck this into a tight space or the back of your TV/Monitor has a tight space it might be an issue.This product is roughly twice the size of all my other HDMI cables. (most of those are 3' to 6' long)

Not a certified cable. Most importantly, will not send 4k 60hz from Win 10 to my TV. Causes black screen flashed frequently throughout the day. Picked up a Cablematters one that works perfectly. Get that instead if you're looking for 4k 60hz and HDR and Dolby Atmos.

I only bought this for when my Son's friends come over and they bring their PS4's to hook up to his bedroom TV. I used to use one of our "good" cables and then got tired of plugging and unplugging it so wanted a cable I didn't care about to just leave there.Like other reviewers have said, this cable is every bit as good as any other cables we have bought for much more money and this one is abused terribly on a regular basis by many different children, plugged in and unplugged over and over and over and its still fine.

We used these in our conference rooms with TV setups and so far they have been working great.One thing to really make sure is that these are NOT bidirectional cables. Meaning you have to pay attention to the labels at the end of each cable connector otherwise they won’t work.

Connections are of good quality and I have had no issues with picture or sound quality. The only issue I have with this cable is that it is ridiculously thick and heavy. In some regards that is a good thing, but when it comes to routing, it is not easy to tuck, bend or hide. The cable that this one is replacing (due to a pet chewing it) was much thinner and I had it tucked between the carpet and base board. Not this beast. It also puts a lot of stress on HDMI ports due to the weight. I had to route it differently and zip tie it because I was worried about damaging ports. I suspect this length is rated to be installed inside of building walls. That would explain the extra thickness and shielding but I do not see it in the listing anywhere. The cable lengths below 15 feet appear to be "normal" cable in the pictures.TL;DR

Before I bought this, I feel like I was living a lie.I love televisions. I also love my Playstation 4. Before I got this AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI 6 foot cable, I would do what I expect most people would do. I would turn on my system and imagine what was probably going on inside of it. I have a large TV, so it was always easy for me to picture Netflix, Hulu, or what ever game I think I have. I have spent hours on the couch just staring at the TV, imagining all sorts of things.

I bought this cable. A few months later it broke. Just stopped working one day. It was used in a safe manner off the floor so there was no way to receive physical damage. I put in a support ticket and they sent a new one without ever contacting me back which was super nice. Yesterday it stopped working too and there is no way for me to put in a support request for the replacement.

I needed a HDMI cable to run from my laptop to a 1st generation TV with HDMI input.However the existing one I had on hand that came with the TV was crazy poor quality and when I plugged it in, I didnt get the audio channels to the tv!!

My computer, which is hooked up to a tv started having green lines streak across the screen off and on. this got progressively worse until it would happen every few minutes. I then amped down the resolution to 2160px1440p and I saw better results, however even that didn't last long, as the green lines started to appear again. I know this is not the TV because the lines only appeared when hdmi was plugged in and casting onto the TV screen. Got another hdmi cord that can supposedly do 8k, so that would be my recommendation to anyone looking for a cord that can do 4k, shop around and find a better one. Don't trust this cord because it says Amazon Basics.

Purchased these hefty cables after being loaned another pair from my neighbor.  His cables were also excellent quality from Amazon's own brand.  When mine arrived, the first thing I noticed is the thickness of the cable.  His cables were half the diameter as the ones I ordered.  Not sure why so thick.  The quality is there and overall they are well made.I have decided to keep the cable as they work the same.  Recommended

The HDMI cables were great but for only 4 months. I got 3 of the 10 ft. and they just stopped working. The first one went out 2 weeks ago. My second one just went out on Sunday of last week. They are not bending or being chewed on because I have them running behind the wall and I have no pets. Maybe others have had better experiences, but I only have one left and that one is connected to my security camera's so I am afraid it will go out any minute. Buyer beware.

I needed an HDMI cable to connect my smart TV to my laptop. This was perfect and I've come to trust and love Amazon brand products. These were of great quality, no less than other brand name cables. The picture was perfect, no issues with connections whatsoever and for a value price. I was so satisfied I ordered a two more HDMI cables and all worked great. AmazonBasics has become the go-to-brand for when I need products like these.

I have my TV hooked up to a laptop on my desk via this 25 foot (7.62m) HTMI cable. It works perfectly. It's a thick and sturdy cable, picture quality is great. Well worth the money. So now I do work on my laptop and when I want to watch something in the evening, I can just plug in the cable and project anything from my laptop onto the TV. Paired with a wireless keyboard, this is way simpler than getting a roku or other such device.

The description says two different things: Meets the latest HDMI standards (4K Video at 60 Hz, 2160p, 48 bit/px color depth) that supports bandwidth up to 18Gbps and backwards compatible with earlier versions" and also "The AmazonBasics HDMI cable displays 4K video at 24 Hz, 1080p at 60 Hz, with 48-bit deep color, and supports bandwidth of 10.2 Gbps."I found that the cable I bought supports 4K at 60Hz, but only if HDR is disabled. When HDR is enabled, the cable only supports 30Hz. I was initially disappointed, but apparently HDMI up to 2.0 specs can only support 30hz with 4K HDR with RGB, so this cable appears to perform with the latest support.

We replaced all our aged HDMI cables with these. Where our new components had been working, they had various hiccups like the HTPC display adapter not syncing with the receiver, through to the tv unless we switched inputs away & back. Also the receiver-to-tv (4k) channel seems to have stopped switching frequencies every so often, I expect because throughput was bottlenecked at the cable there. Anyway, it all works great now!

The 25 ft (7.6M)  HDMI cable from amazon basics does what it should and was surprisingly thicker than expected. At first I considered it a drawback but in reality it simply means its well shielded. Because of the extra shielding, it won't have any issues if it rests on or along power cables (even though you should try to keep them from touching).Lastly, I'm  slightly annoyed that amazon bundles all the reviews together for a range of products. The shorter cables and longer cables are very different things. That being said, I've used a variety of amazon basics HDMI and displayport cables over the years and never had an issue with any of them.

Unless you have a bunch of uninsulated or extremely high voltage electrical wires or powerful magnet meer inches away from the cable, you don't need to spend over $15 on an HDMI cable. I have cables 10+ years old that still work as good as the day I bought them...

I buy a lot of Amazon Basics products because they tend to be really good quality and at an affordable price. This is no different. It was long enough for what I needed because I wanted to fish it through the wall and use it with my mounted TV. The shipping time was excellent as usual, and the quality is perfect for what I need. It isn't anything fancy, but for an HDMI cable it doesn't need to be.
One of the cables failed already....after less than a week of being installed...Lost Audo and would not pass High Speed  or HDR signalChanged out cable & all OK....

A sub-10 dollar HDMI cable that is 10 feet long?  Sign me up!  This cable is perfectly competent, and appears to be built with quality materials.  Although you shouldn't be plugging and unplugging any HDMI device frequently, there's definitely no fear of the cable failing due to normal handling.  Don't save a few pennies by getting a shorter cable-- you'll never regret getting a 3-meter+ length cable!Side Note:  There's a lot of brands out there, some who will give you a sslligghhttlyy lower price.  I don't recommend it.  Although HDMI cables generally either work or don't, not all are made equal; this is the perfect intersection between price and quality, so thanks Amazon basics!

To start I bought a 75" TCL series6 TV . when I hooked up my Xbox s thru my elite receiver and was having flicking so I went to 5 below picked up there HDR 48 bit cable 12' the only size they sell for HDR cable. that fixed the flickering but when I started up Netflix my pic went black and when it came back the colors where wrong.. I got this AMAZON cable replaced it and all works fine  HDR,  DOBLY VISON. cables are good.. for all formats.

For a long time, I thought my TV had issues with HDMI inputs. My screen would go black for a few seconds every so often while the audio would continue playing. I didn't think it could be the HDMI cable - after all, AmazonBasics is a trusted brand and all modern HDMI cables should be able to handle 4K HDR, and the audio wasn't cutting out. But eventually I replaced the cable with the other one from the 2-pack of 10ft cables I had bought. And just like that my glitches stopped happening.Since one cable works but the other glitches out, I'm going to speculate the manufacturing quality is not consistent. Even though the second cable seems okay, I'm replacing it with a certified premium HDMI cable - both MonoPrice and CableMatters have ones that are not much more expensive than this one.

I was super excited to receive this!  Unfortunately, the connection continually gets disconnected and the screen goes black. Sometimes it pops back on but most of the time I have to unplug it and plug it back in. I know that it's not my other equipment of my tv because I use the exact same setup with a different brand and shorter length cable and it works great with no issue. I bought this for length but can't use it because it doesn't work. Also frustrating is that my program doesn't pause when it disconnects so I'm constantly having to rewind.

I recently purchased the FOCUS Power headphones and am already experiencing poor quality sound and Bluetooth connectivity issues. It sometimes takes several attempts before the headphones connect to my iPhone and I can literally walk maybe 2 feet away from my phone and will lose the connection. In addition to the connectivity issue, the volume quality is poor in that it sometimes doesn’t increase/decrease when adjusting it. Overall, very disappointed in the poor quality/performance. I’m planning to replace the headphones very soon before they completely die on me.

The hardware itself is great. Chrome OS on the other hand is mostly terrible... My biggest complaint is the file system because it cannot handle more than 50 folders or 1000 files in a given directory before it crashes. It reminds me of how clunky drive.google.com is when dealing with a directory with 300+ folders. Try moving a file to your desired folder and you will know what I mean.This might be great for a casual user or as an HTPC but I did not spend enough time with it to test this.

It worked fine for about a year, but at this point it's unusable.  The cable now causes any output display to have a flicker/distortion at the top and bottom of the screen. I've tried three different displays (2 TVs. 1 monitor)  and two different outputs (computer/Switch), it's definitely the cable.  It's been sitting almost untouched for the entirety of its use, no bends or kinks in the cable.I have HDMI cables from ages ago that still hold up, I've never seen a cable fail like this without being abused in some way.  If you want something that's going to last, just pay a few bucks more for something you won't have to waste time testing and replacing.

With eighteen months of installing this 50-foot HDMI cable, it has stopped working. Thorough testing revealed that everything except this cable works. The failure occurred without any movement of the cable. I wasn’t unplugging it ever. Picture quality was good until there was no picture, so a couple stars. Same for all other qualities.

I did not know that HDMI cables are not all the same and the one I ordered was far more advanced then what I needed.  It didn't work for me on my Smart TV and simple lap top computer.  I am sure it works good on TV's and computers that are equipped for this model.  I only wanted a standard HDMI cable which I now have and it works good.  Amazon did give me a refund for which I am grateful.

Bought this to go along with my Asus HDMI monitor that I had bought at the same time. This cable in nice and flexible unlike some others I have that are kind of stiff. This is a perfectly fine HDMI cable. Don't let anyone tell you different and try to talk you into getting a high dollar HDMI cable when it is proven there is absolute no difference in the signal quality. It's all smoke and mirrors and hype. This cable does the job and saves you some money.

Needed to connect my laptop to TV so I could watch streaming basketball on a big screen.  Given its low price, I was concerned that this cable would just be cheap in terms of quality.  No, it is more cost effective than I could have imagined.  Absolutely perfect, in fact.  No apparent degradation of video quality.  Ordered one size longer than I thought I needed, so I have some flexibility in where the laptop sits.  Highly recommended.

I needed to upgrade my 2 TV / Sound installations because I added several new devices, a 4K TV, etc. and the cables I was currently using were pretty old, one as old a 8 years. If you read up you will find out that devices like Ultra 4K TV boxes require them to be connected via High Speed HDMI cabling. The Amazon cables were so reasonable, I decided to replace all 6 cables with the new Amazon High Speed HDMI cables and I'm glad I did. My wife’s TV was getting the "circle of streaming death" circles, which went away with the new cables. I heartedly reccomend these cables.

I've used these on several tv's used as computer monitors at 4K and 4:4:4 color at 60hz, basically the highest bitrate supported by hdmi 2.0, and they work well. At anything higher they might glitch slightly, but that's beyond their stated spec. For the price you can't go wrong.

Used it a total of maybe 10 times to play Games on my TV with my PC. Every time I use it now it's a gamble of either the sound or video working, never both. That's what I get for buying a cheap HDMI I suppose.

There's nothing especially amazing about these, they're cables. I don't know what High-Speed is supposed to mean, the cable has no impact on the "speed" of your connection. The material quality is acceptable, nothing to write home about. I would have preferred color coding options like some other cables I've gotten but if you don't need or care for that and just need something functional, yeah, this is fine.

I’ve used this to connect chromebook, mac, and an HP to a tv to watch shows/movies, and it’s worked perfectly each time. I highly recommend this if you want to watch shows/movies online but on a bigger screen. You just connect the cord to your computer & tv, put the tv to hdmi channel, and it should display your computer screen on the tv. For chromebook, I have to go to the laptop settings and change the display from laptop to tv.

A simple enough, cheap HDMI cord. I got the 10 ft one doesn't while 6 ft seems like it should be enough I was worried my setup would need a bit more. Regardless of that rambling, it's cheap, it works just as well as the high end ones, and the material doesn't feel cheap. It doesn't feel like it's going to break if you wap it accidentally or become rubbish in 6 months time. I highly recommend this.

Finally upgraded my desktop graphics card to a gtx 1070sc with 2 hd monitors where I was originally using both monitors on dvi connection. The new gfx card only has 1 dvi connection, so I needed to upgrade to hdmi.This got the job done at a reasonable price, and the cables are easy to route, don't seem too fragile, and aren't stubborn in form (easy to manipulate).

I picked this up to extend the HDMI of my HTC Vive, along with long power and USB 3 cables.  I ran this cable between the link box and the headset's own cables, with a coupler, despite most people recommending extending the cables between the computer and the link box.  It works very well, no problems, and allows me to leave the link box safely tucked away near the computer.

I am going to say this is a 5 star cable.  Updating my review of HDMI cable.  Perfect!!  I won't admit to my initial mistake but I know I need to use my glasses all the time.  The package arrived in two days, great packaging, works great. This is to connect my iPad Pro to the TV so I can help two neighbors fully use their iPads. (NOTE: NEED AN ADAPTER for the iPad to connect to HDMI)  Sorry about my first reaction.

Great cord. Very heavy duty, so keep that in mind. It's much thicker than your average HDMI cord. So if you are trying to plug this in behind a tv you might have an issue because it is not very flexible.I used this to run across the ceiling to connect PS4 to a projector mounted on the ceiling. So the rigidness wasn't an issue. It definitely will not fit in the standard cord runners. Will have to buy a mutli cord runner to cover it.

This item has not shown any problems during use for a few months.  It was thicker and less flexible than I expected.  I'm not sure if that is a good thing or not.  It could be that the larger cable allows for larger wires with better transmission, however it could just be a thicker cable with the same conductors as thinner cables.  In my setup the flexibility is not a problem, but I could see someone having trouble if the cable needed to make tight (<2 in ?) turns to fit.

These are absolutely terrible quality. I used them to connect my TV to my Roku and the picture clarity is vastly diminished as well as the sound which gives an awful, distracting crunching noise repeatedly when making selections requiring me to unplug and re-connect it regularly. Spare yourselves and just spend a little more to get a quality product with e reputable brand.

Beware:  The AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable is actually two different products, depending on the length.  Shorter lengths are what you would expect in terms of diameter and stiffness.  Starting at the 15-foot length though, the cable diameter and stiffness are much greater, which makes it hard to uncoil, difficult to manipulate and impossible to hide.  I will be returning the 25-foot cables I just purchased because I basically can't work with them.  Instead I bought perfectly good alternative cables on eBay.  Ouch!

This cable was purchased to connect my ceiling mounted projector. It works great, but I was not expecting this to be such a thick cable. It says it is hdmi with ethernet which would account for the thickness. I would have chosen another option if I had known. Cable works fine and serves its purpose, just beware if you have limited space in a cable concealer, it may be a tight fit.
Despite not carrying any official HDMI spec rating to speak of, I can confirm that this cable carries:- A 4k, HDR signal at 60Hz

This is another item that can be found in many stores these days. However the value for the length was great!  My techy son told me to buy these here because of the many financial benefits.  I am glad I did because when I looked at them in a one of the local stores they were 18.99!  YIKES.  They are JUST cables.  Shaking my head at the craziness of the world of retail.

If ypu are in need of an HDMI cable and don't mind waiting a few days, this is your best bet.  Inexpensive, quality built and reliable, the Amazon Basics cable works just fine for 99% of your video needs.  Sure, there may be cases when you need an expensive high end cable but those are few and far between.  This cable will suffice for most of your needs.

Didn't work properly as description suggested. I attempted to connect a laptop to new Samsung 4K television and no "source" was recognized. I replaced this cable with a SecurOMax 15 foot cable and it works perfectly. I connected to the same locations on each device and in the same order. I had the exact same problem with a 3 foot version of this cable a few months ago and used a SecurOMax version as a successful replacement back then as well. Something else surprising was how thick this cable is compared to shorter ones and how stiff it is compared to the replacements I purchased. It would have been a challenge to make tight turns to hide the cable.  I'm giving 2 stars for great pricing and b/c I've been extremely satisfied with all other AmazonBasics products.

I purchased many HDMI cables throughout the years from the $30 one to the inexpensive one. The Amazon branded ones have been my go to lately. Inexpensive and the quality as great. It does not look as fancy as the expensive cables but who cares, it is sitting behind the cabinet and the picture quality is perfect.Save yourself some money and go with the Amazon branded HDMI cable.

I've bought some of these at 3', 10', and two at 25'. Only the 3' one has worked. I recently bought a 4K TV and needed a 25' cable to run between my PC and TV. It didn't work so I got another figuring it was a bad cable but the replacement didn't work either. In both cases the signal dropped out constantly and I could not run 4K content at 60hz. Got a cable from Monoprice and it has worked great. It was a bit pricier than these but I'll gladly pay for a product that does what it claims to. The 3' one I got has been fine, but I just tried to use the 10' one for an NES Classic and it too doesn't work. The few times I get a signal it's either audio or video and it drops out frequently.Overall I'm really disappointed and won't be buying anymore Amazon branded cables.

These are durable and seem well made. I can tell the difference between hd and standard obviously and to me the hd picture is fine with these hd cables. The sound also seems just fine. I’m not one of those people that can tell the smaller details in picture and sound with different types/quality of hdmi cables so with me being perfectly happy, I gave 5 stars. Price was also good compared to some others.

It came new and it worked great. I just bought it because I didn't realize the cord I needed wasnt a HDMI cord i needed something different. But I will defiantly buy from this seller again. There absolutely amazing. Things come quick and if you buy a wrong item or something they are on top of it to make you a happy customer. So thank you so much i appreciate the service.

I ordered this 3 pack of HDMI cables to connect Apple TV to my LG smart tv.  I also had to replace one of the cables to my dvd player.  I got these cables with no delivery or packaging issues.  It was pretty cut and dry as they were easy to plug in and I did not have any problems with the signal or quality from my components to the tv.  They are working well so far and would recommend them.

The cable works for in-wall video cabling. Recommend for 1080p cable TV runs to all types to your cable box. The cable length was 50 feet. Make sure you plug the plug marked TV into the HDMI slot on the TV and the HDMI plug marked  Source is plugged into the Cable box. This will save a lot of grief and time, not having to run the cable more than once.

Wow!  This cable is very heavy duty.  Really thick, much heavier than any other brand name cables I have.  It is used to connect the TV to a laptop so that we can sit across the room and put Google Earth,  family pics and videos and streaming video on the big screen for everyone to see while having the laptop right at your side for control.

Great quality cables. Bought them along with a 2-1 HDMI switch that didn’t include the cables. It’s about time that you can buy inexpensive HDMI cables that are also great quality. I remember a good gold plated HDMI cable would cost $50 from RadioShack and one less than $15 off eBay was complete trash. Get these, you will not be disappointed. Keep in mind HDMI cables are not meant to be continuously plugged and unplugged. For that you should get a heavy duty one but I guarantee the port on the device will stop working before the cable gives out. HMDI ports were also not meant to have cables be continuously plugged and unplugged. This is why I got a switch.

They say all HDMI cables are the same. They say they either carry a signal, or they don't. I disagree. I bought a PlayStation 4 Pro. It came with a high speed HDMI cable. I thought that the picture looked grainy. Text on the screen had harsh edges. I was like "wth is going on? My old PS4 didn't look like this." Games looked funny, like a mixture of blurry and pixelated. Then I tried this Amazon Basics cable. Text on the PS4 menu now looks smooth and easy on the eyes. Games are crisp and clear now. So I tested the cable that came with my PS4 Pro on a television with a bluray player...same thing; a blurry, pixelated image. That is a lot of signal denigration to take place over a six foot cable.So I guess all HDMI cables aren't created equal after all.

I purchased this cable in the Spring and used it in a TV, and it worked great for a couple months. I was away for the summer, so the cable was stored safely in a dry place and protected from dust and extreme temperatures. It wasn't used for those three months. When I came back, it was no longer working. I get no picture and no sound when I plug it in. I've tested multiple TV's, multiple devices, everything I can to make sure it actually is the cable that is malfunctioning. I'm disappointed, because the Amazon products are usually better quality than this and typically last much longer than the competitors.

This worked great for 3 months and then it started acting up. Some colors started flickering/distorting intermittently. Netflix started giving HDCP (High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection) errors. The error went away upon rebooting my Nvidia Shield. Then I started getting intermittent blackouts. Again, rebooting the Shield fixed this. Contacted Amazon and they are sending out a new cable with 1-day shipping. Fantastic customer support.

I've paid much more for expensive "name brand" hdmi cables as I thought surely one had to have the best quality cable to produce stunning high definition and 4k video, right?  Boy was I wrong.... I ordered this just to try it (as an add on with other things I was ordering from Amazon) and when I hooked it up, I could not believe my eyes - this cable was producing an image that was just as good as cables that were ten times this price.  Don't waste your hard earned money on pricey cables when you can get the same quality for much less.  Thanks for once again exceeding my expectations Amazon :)

Wow! This Hdmi cable is very good quality.bought it to hook up my laptop with my 26 inch philips tv and the picture, sound is amazingly best on its class. $7 worth to spend.  Highly Recommened.Ps : not a paid reviewer.

Frequent signal loss and green screens with 3ft cable. 6ft cable didn't even work. Not compatible with HDR and chroma 4:2:0. Turning either off helped some. Replaced with a $12 "8K" cable and everything was fine. So much wasted time troubleshooting this junk Amazon cable. I ran check HDMI connection after replacing it for fun, and the AppleTV actually displayed that my cable was looking better.

If you still have anything hooked up to your HDTV with old AV cables, change them if you can.  On a 60" Sharp Aquos, there was a slight difference in picture.  The real difference was with the audio.  I had an old Bluray player for a long, long time.  So long that it used to be hooked up to a tube TV.  Back then they didn't include HDMI cables with a new purchase.  Sound was always a bit muted, no matter how I adjusted it.  Especially dialogue.  On many movies, the sound effects would cover up what was being said.  Not a problem now.  I did this a while back with my PS3 and the difference was amazing.  That time I bought the Sony cables.  These Amazon cables are half the price but work just the same.

I reported previously to Amazon that this cable did not work with my new monitor.  I WAS WRONG!  After further testing, this cable proved to be perfect!  I am very sorry that I rushed to judgment about it.  If there were a way to have Amazon reconsider giving me my money back, I would like them to do this, because I need to pay for this cable.So sorry for MY mistake.

I've always had confidence in Amazon's AV cables, and this High-Speed HDMI cable is no exception.  I have a 50" Vizio TV in my bedroom that is mounted with a Cheetah mount (APTMM2B), and I also have the Datacomm 50-3323-WH-KIT installed behind the TV for cable management.  I ordered this 10' HDMI cable so that I could connect my Apple TV (ATV) to my TV.  As you can see from the picture, the cable is a perfect length to go down behind the whole and back up to our ATV.  The video and audio from the ATV to my TV is excellent.Like most Amazon shoppers, I count on honest, unbiased reviews.  I hope you have found this review helpful in making your purchase decision.

I appreciate the construction of the cable, as I have seen many with thin, unshielded cables with cheap plastic hdmi connectors.  I originally purchased the fifteen foot cable to connect a Mac mini (hdmi) to my Vizio for across the room use. The cable length was/is perfect for that set up, and worked flawlessly. I realize now that I could have purchased a 3ft. version, and placed my Mac mini on the mantle under the mounted TV, and still used the bluetooth kb and mouse across the room. Oh well, trial and error. Great product at a great price.

Cable is ok....I did notice my main TV would show less than second jitter, in fact you may have a hard time noticing it as it is random....swapped to another cable bought from this seller, same result but when swapped to a different cable brand no jitter. My other TVs use these cable with no issues....so it may come down to just the TV brand incompatible with this particular hdmi cable brand.

Bought these to replace older 6 foot cables that were not high speed or 4k ready.  I just got a new 55" Hisense H9plus and wanted to better hide all the cords. I got some 10 foot cables.  These worked great with the TV, my disc player and TiVo.  They were also far cheaper then the marked up cables they push you to buy at Best Buy when you buy a tv set.Edit. I just bought a new LG 4k DVD player. I have had no issues with these cables. Dolby vision and HDR  were supported

my tv would not connect to my direct receiver - everything kept saying change cables.  I did and didn't see a difference in the HDMI cable.  Had to move the cable to the 2nd HDMI and changed the tv to the 2nd HDMI mode- still no difference.  Finally have two weeks the direct receiver finally realized the difference.  I guess I fixed the problem I don't know - I just know the tv works now.

When I purchased my new UHD 4k television last month, both the big box club and leading best consumer electronics store associates both directed me to Amazon Basics HDMI cables.  Both associates stated Amazon Basics cables offered high quality at low prices. Who was I to argue and purchased 3, 6 and 9 feet sets. Picture quality awesome and have provided this information to friends and family. Some of have purchased same have same opinion: Amazon Basics rocks!

There is not a whole lot to say about a HDMI cable.  For the most part they either work or they don't work.  There is a little difference in cables with picture quality but by and large I have found most HDMI cables are pretty similar.  This one is no expectation.  It is a solid low cost HDMI cable that allows for a good picture and audio.

Was having issues with my ps4 pro displaying to my samsung MU7000. Online forums said the HDMI cable may be the culprit and to get the high speed newer standard that these claim to meet. Immediately have the same issue. I ended up upgrading to a belkin cable which solved the problem.These may work fine for TV signals, but I wouldn't recommend them for gaming.

HDMI2 failed for sound quality.  Sound was broken/fractured on all channels.  I am a fan of Amazon Basics.  Refund was immediate. As this was for a wall mounted 4K TV I did not attempt a replacement.  I would normally choose a replacement but way too much effort for a mounted TV.

I have never seen the point of really expensive cabling. These are good, daily cables for short distances and low end signals. For large installs, and high frequency work that may need better shielding, or whatever, I guess the real techies would argue for better cables. For us ordinary Joes these are just fine. If you are putting in a home theater system and want audio and video quality, I guess you'll have to get better cables.. Check with an expert.

These days, you really have to be careful buying cables on Amazon, as there's many knockoffs that appear to be quality products that simply aren't. If you buy *any* AmazonBasics product, you'll get quality and the reputation of Amazon directly backing that item.So, here's an HDMI cable that I needed for an AppleTV (still don't understand why they can't include one in the box with a device that costs around $200 but oh well). Maybe I could have found one cheaper, or more colorful, but I buy a lot of Amazon Basics products (computer Mice, especially) and figured I'd go with a brand I trust and a great price.

Had one cable just stop working after a week!! Very disappointing especially after I had cables hidden and fed through track just to have to pull it out a week later to install another new cable! Not sure why amazon would put their stamp on these??Update: I purchased the 10’ ones but just read some reviews and they say the 6’ or less work but greater than 6’ cables others are seeing the same issues I had for what that is worth to ya.

replaced my old 8' Monster HDMI cables, didnt notice any difference so they're good to go! Much cheaper than the Monster cables too. I'm using them on a midgrade 4K Samsung 55" tv with gaming consoles. Not so much movie or tv watching.

Perfect! I wanted these to be able to use the ARC function on my new TV (since it doesn't have an analog audio out), and does a great job. The truth is HDMI cables either work or they don't. There is no such thing as a better quality signal, so paying more for a brand that claims something like that is pointless. Yes, it's true that you can pay more for a better constructed cable that is more durable, physically robust and resistent to wear, less likely to kink, etc., but if unless you have money to burn, why would you? These work perfectly as expected and the price is right. What else is there to say?

I wasn’t planning on putting a tv in my room but I got a brand newflat screen for free from a family member, and I didn’t want to pay more for cable. So I got this hdmi cable to connect it to my computer to watch what I want. It works really well, and it’s super easy to use. It’s like connecting your phone to a charger, can’t get any easier. It’s strong and durable and it’s a long cord so it reaches pretty far.

This cables was perfect for my needs. I just wanted something to connect my laptop to the TV and this cable more than fits the bill. It is much heavier than I thought it would be and you can tell it is well made. The picture quality is fantastic as well. It was sent in a very sturdy box with removable caps on both ends. I would recommend this to anyone one looking for a well made HDMI cable.

These are great HDMI cables. Strong, good picture, etc. However, they are HUGE. As in, thick. Very thick. Too thick. I bought four of these to replace shorter cables for our wall-mounted TV. But these cords are so thick, I can only fit two in our cord concealment system (that used to have four cables running through it). Because of this I can only truly recommend these for other uses besides home theater systems.

For whatever reason these will not work at all with a PS4 Pro and a Samsung KS8000 TV (just get a black screen as if nothing is connected). What's hilarious is that some old Amazon basics cable that I had DOES work with this 4K HDR configuration. They work fine with a few of my other hdmi devices, but really bummed out since I ordered replacements and they didn't work out either.

I used this to connect a HDMI cable from TV to my Nintendo Switch. The old cable stopped working and needed replacement. I looked around and I'm happy with the quality and build of the cable. The length of the cable is good as well. I'm using the other cable from this 2-pack bundle to connect the monitor I use for streaming to my desktop. Again, I'm really happy with the cable.

I bought this one (15 feet) to replace the shorter cable I bought from the same Amazon brand. This one seems to be not only longer but thicker, which seems to be better quality. It only took a month for it to stop transmitting sound. Disappointed. The shorter one (10 feet) worked fine I bought a couple of years ago still work fine though.
I hooked this cable to my TV. It is the 2nd HDMI input. The 1st one is for cable.This one is for my laptop. For some reason, when I switched to this 2nd HDMI input, the TV speaker gave a low hum.

I was so fortunate to come across such a good deal as this. These cables work great, and they are very durable. The insulation is thick and can withstand a lot of bends. They're the perfect length for my entertainment needs! If you need a few, don't hesitate to buy these!

Even with the best of 20 or 25 foot passive HDMI cables my connection from my Apple computer to my Samsung flat screen TV suffered from repeated dropouts and failures to handshake.Finally bought the active version of this cable (35 foot) and my HDMI feed is now rock solid, even though nearly half of it is coiled behind the TV stand.

Are you looking for something that looks like an HDMI cord but isn't?! Then you're in luck. First one they sent didn't work, so they sent a second (to their credit it was free). Niether worked! I have two TVs both have 2+ HDMI ports to try and I tried it with two laptops and a Nintendo switch (using the USB-C to HDMI adapter) to make sure it was the cord and not something else.

Edit: One of the 2 cables stopped working after the first day. It was fine the first time I played a movie, but the next day when I turned on the blu-ray player, it showed the blu-ray logo on screen for a second then went black and the signal cut out. No matter how many times I unplugged and plugged everything back in, it did the same thing. I switched over to the other cable and that one seems to be working.Original review:

Our fire TV device suddenly stopped working. The cable looked fine and we eve tried multiple TVs and HDMI ports. It was the damn cable all along. So we bought this one and it works great. Even the pitcure quality looks more crisp now. I had no idea hdmi cables just crap out randomly. Now I know. Try replacing the HDMI cable before anything else.

Though it works as it should, it is VERY thick and heavy.  I didn't expect it to be so heavy duty.  My original plan was using this with my laptop to stream movies onto my TV, and though I can do this and it works well, the cable is very thick and heavy.  Much thicker than a standard HDMI cable.  About the same thickness as an orange extension cord.  Yes...that thick.  It's definitely made to last, that's for sure.As for its performance, it works as it should.  No artifacts.

This item was everything I expected it to be and was delivered promptly. I had shopped in town for this item and the prices were outrageous. I shaved off at least $15 from the best price from local merchants. The performance of the HDML cable which connected a Blue-Ray player to my OLED smart TV was without complaint. I recommend this item and the price cannot be beat (unless of course it was a gift and thus a freebie).

Works great for hooking my Sony Blu-Ray player to Samsung TV.  They are both older models, and I previously only had them linked with RCA cables (which broke, hence the replacement).  I don't know if this is a feature of the TV, or the player, or the cables, but now that they are connected via HDMI, the TV turns itself on whenever I load a disc in the player AND the TV's remote works as a second remote for the player!  This is totally cool, wish I'd known this years ago, I would've switched to HDMI way sooner.

Great affordable High speed hdmi wires. I've been using them a month with my new LG OLED tv and they work great.
