I was wondering if there was going to be any noticable downgrade in quality but the Dolbyvision and HDR10 content I watch looks amazing.The cable is a no frills thick black cord. I don't run any hifi sound in my setup, so I can't comment on sound quality. Also since I've only had them a month, I can't speak to their durability, but they seem to be made as well as the cables I paid much more for when I bought my last tv.

For 12 months, the cords worked perfectly but 13 months in, the cords stopped working with our Roku and Blu-ray player. I paid more for the Amazon Basics for Prime delivery and because I thought I could trust the name. They just dropship these cords from the same low quality manufacturers as all the other resellers. BUYER BEWARE. Amazon Basics are just good enough to last through the warranty so they don't have to replace them and so you come back to Amazon to buy another cord. I will see if my credit card company will do anything for me (extended warranty benefits).

First off, a pack of (2) 2.0 HDMI cables is a steal. These cables immediately made a difference on the quality of the content when I hooked them up to my Sony 4K tv. The prior cables I was using were too long, bulky and of the previous model.The cables are gold plated and you can tell the quality is on par. I highly recommend. I was skeptical at first being an Amazon name brand. Not that I have had a bad experience before, but I am the type of guy that buys name brand products. Not for everything, but with electronics I do. These are top notch and highly recommend.

Purchased a bundle of 3 in early 2018. They look well made but do not seem to last. Two of them been plugged to a TV, Nintendo Switch and nVidia Shield TV. Both of the cables stopped displaying any signal after about 2 years.Pinpointing the issue the first time was frustrating, the one on the Switch failed first and a couple of hours were spent fiddling with the dock, the TV, the switch and a computer monitor to rule things out. The cable is pretty much the last thing you would expect to fail out of the blue. Once it failed with the Shield TV it was quicker to figure out the culprit after the previous experience.

HDMI cables either work or they don't. These work fine. In most cases, one connects an HDMI cable and never moves it again. Therefore, any HDMI cable will suffice. If you have a use case in which you're going to connect and disconnect a cable, then materials and construction matter. While we haven't abused these cables, they have held up very well, even when used to periodically connect a laptop to a TV.
This did not support high speed 4k hdr dolby vision.  It did support 4k hdr, but not dolby vision because it was not 18 Gbps.

I disliked that I didn't measure the length more accurately - too much cable to wrangle thru.  Needing new cables solved my problem which was one solution given to me to get everything up and running when I turn on the tv.  I've been using the same cords I bought t least 8 yrs ago - nothing lasts forever, who would have thunk it with this item? Reading the reviews swade me to go with the thinner (I think) cable instead of the braided.

I purchased this cable to connect my HTC Vive to a PC in another room. This cable is extremely solid. It feels more like an extension cable than any HDMI cable I have owned in the past.No issues connecting an Nvidia 970GTX to the Vive Link box.

Cable is causing interference.I have an Apple TV 4K and when I push a 4K signal to my tv, the Bluetooth remote is very unresponsive. If I change my applets to move only a 1080 signal, then the remote works just fine.

At one time I would have been a cable snob and insist on Monster or some other way out of priced product.  Now that I am older and wiser I figured out you do not need some overly priced cable to get a good picture.  So I got Amazon branded cable and got a great picture without blowing the grocery money for the week.  Great product at a great price, what more do you want?

Used the product to run my VR unit in the living room for room-scale from the computer in the office. Had plenty of slack in the cable, and took care not to bind of kink it while wrapping it up. The cable feels very stiff, and didn't wrap too well. The cable stopped projecting a picture after about a dozen uses. I would not recommend this product for anyone looking to set up and tear down the connection fairly regularly.

I bought this HDMI cable because it said it works with 4K. It does, but only at 30hz and not 60hz which most 4K needs to display on your TV. It’s almost impossible to find a 4K TV that has a 30hz HDMI input. Usually they only have a 60hz input and therefore using this cable you will not got an image on your TV.

Cable TV is just too expensive, so I ditched it, but I do not have a smart TV.  This worked perfectly to run from my laptop to my television, and I can watch Netflix or Amazon Prime Video without any issues at all.  Because of the length, it just stays hooked up permanently.  Wonderful picture, no issues at all.  I got the 25 foot cable and it only ended up being a few dollars more than the 15 foot, definitely worth it.  This cable is pretty heavy, it is definitely not junk.

Great cheap cable, that runs at the latest hdmi standard (as of this review). you don't need expensive hdmi cables since it is a digital signal, not an analog signal, signal degradation is not an issue like it used to be. All you need is a cable that has the specifications that you need. Cnet has a great article on this called "Why all hdmi cables are the same" that you can read if you are more interested in why you don't need expensive hdmi cables. this runs on my 4k tv playing video games from my gaming computer at up to 60Hz flawlessly.

After reading a CNET article (and another one mentioning the same thing), I decided that I did not need fancy HDMI cables and chose these.  They perform well and are indeed basic, as they don't have fancy (or thick) connectors and the flex jacket is not as thick as others.  However, for the price, they are difficult to beat.  I ended up with these as backups and Monoprice cables as my main ones, but I genuinely think there is no difference in performance between the two.

Great cord. No issue with this cord and connects to HD tv from Laptop as promised. The cord is accurate at 10 feet and there are gold plates that plug into both devices (as pictured). I've had this cord for a while now and gave it some serious use. I would recommend this one as a great quality option. The picture is great and the ports are nice and tight with the cords plugs in. Like any other cord I wouldn't twist it too much around and/or buy a cord with the actual length you need so you're not always bending it causing the cord to damage. It's not cheap so it will hold up (and it's shape) but I would consider purchasing the exact length that you need :)
Although it is cheap product, It can provide high sound and picture quality, It has been 3 years , since I ordered it, still using it without any problem

When this package arrived, I picked up the box and immediately thought Amazon had gotten my order wrong because the box was so heavy.  When I opened the box, there were the two items I ordered inside: a padded envelope with a thunderbolt to HDMI adapter (not a heavy item) and a box containing this cable.  Holy smokes, this thing would survive a nuclear blast.  Seriously well made, heavy duty cable.  Don't know about longevity but I can't imagine what it would take to damage this cable.

I know the product doesn't advertise that it supports Dolby Vision, but so many reviewers here do.I own brand new Onkyo TX-RZ620, Apple 4K tv, and Vizio PQ65-F1 which all support Dolby Vision.  When running the test on the Apple TV for Dolby Vision, it fails and Apple TV indicates my cables don't support Dolby Vision.  I checked watching directly from my SmartTV function of the Vizio and it was obvious the visual difference while watching Stranger Things on Netflix 4k HDR.  There was so much more detail in the dark scenes when watching Dolby Vision via Smartcast on Vizio.  I'm leaving open the possibility this is operator error but I'll be purchasing different cords that are certified to work with Dolby Vision and see how that goes.

I am pretty skeptical about "4k HDMIs" like the ones they sell at Best Buy for the price of a small house. After upgrading to a 4k TV, I wanted to make sure that I had good HDMI cables to make my PS4 Pro pop. And this one does the trick! It looks incredible with incredibly fast rates and no lag! I would say that there is no difference between these ones from Amazon and the $80 or $90 ones you see advertised as "4k high-quality HDMIs." I recommend you try these first!

I was previously using an HDMI that came with a tv mounting kit and it did it's job, but this one is so much better! When I turn on my ps4 or shield it automatically goes to the input on the tv for them versus the old one which I had to manually do that. Also I watch movies in 4k on my shield with zero lag (my old cable had a little lag here and there). Highly recommend this for 6.99!

I bought this for my xbox 360, as the AV cables were giving me atrocious quality on my unit. Cranked up the resolution to 1080p, and the image is SHARP, very high quality.I must note that the cable is very rigid, but that's about all there is to say about it. Can't say anything about use for it on a monitor as opposed to a TV, but I doubt there's much of a difference.

I am taken back and surprised by how good quality these are! I was iffy buying anything with amazon's name on it because they aren't exactly known for quality or anything good. But they work, they work well, they are thick, the ends seem like they won't fall off and they get the job done! I use them for computer screens.

Bought these because a previous order from a different manufacturer claimed they were 4K capable cables but when I watched a 4K movies from my XBOX One S the video signal would corrupt and stop playing. Isolated it back to the cables. Ordered these and watched a new 4K movie from same XBOX One S and entire movie worked without a hitch. Netflix and gaming as well. These cables work great and are priced great.

I have a Tivo BOLT model and was having problems losing the picture on my tv. I changed the resolution down to 1080p even tho the Bolt and my TV are both set up for 4k, and I can watch tv now. Picture still goes out sporadically. Am waiting for the new cable to get here.  As my mom always said, you get what you pay for.

Not worth it. First of all it would keep losing the signal to my TV when my graphic drivers on my computer needed to be updated. Newsflash: I need to see my computer screen to update the drivers. Firstly I had to switch out my hdmi to update my drivers. Secondly I've had it for approx 3 months and now it has died. No signal at all. Again I thought my drivers needed updating (which they did) and proceeded to flip hdmi cables, after it updated the cable still didn't work and I tested it with my cable box still to a "no signal" message appearing on my TV screen. Do yourself the favor and just get a better quality cable.

Bought this to hook up a UHD blu-ray to an LG 4K tv. It is a great, inexpensive cable (especially when compared to the cost of ones in box stores) that provides great sound and picture. I have not had issues with either since using this playing several 4k discs over the past couple weeks. 6 feet is the perfect length for the setup I have, and I think will be fine for most people. I definitely recommend it for those looking for a high-speed HDMI cable.
For this product, there really isn't much to say.- The lines are strong and you don't have to worry about it getting destroyed somehow.

I've purchased several different lengths of AmazonBasics HDMI cables & have never been disappointed in their performance.I bought these super-long ones (25')  to connect a security camera system to a TV and they work perfectly.  The signal is crisp and clear, problem-free.  Can't beat the price & love knowing I can buy Amazon-quality cables directly from Amazon.  What can I say?  These work great & cost less than most 6 foot HDMI cables.  Highly recommended!

I use it to connect my laptop to my tv. I bought it because I wanted to watch Disney plus but vizio doesn't support that app yet, and it works well, I think the picture quality is good and the cord seems sturdy but also pretty flexible and lite(which I like so it doesn't put to much stress on my HDMI port on my laptop)

This is the third time I have bought HDMI cables from Amazon Basics. They are perfect- providing a great value/price ratio.I have bought expensive HDMI cables before and felt like I was getting ripped off. When I saw these Basics cables, I figured I had nothing to loose. They come in a variety of lengths and work like a charm. I haven't had any comparability problems or issues with not being able to plug in.

I installed this cable from my computer to monitor and the sound went away.  (my speakers are plugged into my monitor.)  I put the older "lower quality " cable back in and things worked fine again.  Tried different settings and could not make this cable transmit the audio signal.  It is going in the trash!

First of all, I was surprised to see how thick the cable was. This one is no cheap, thin type HDMI cable.I am not familiar with all the tech details of specs and stuff but sure that this will withstand all kinds of use or abuse.
This cable (25 ft) seems to be of decent quality, but it is very thick, and heavy. It looks like a heavy extension cord. The biggest drawback to the size, is concealing it. It makes it hard to hide.

High priced HDMI cables work just the same as these. I know there's videophiles out there who will cite studies showing signal loss and noise and yada, yada, yada but the truth is, Amazon Basics HDMI cables put your digital AV on your TV just the same; you cannot possible perceive any difference with the human eye. Buy these cables, save some money, sit back and enjoy your TV.

These work great.  We've never purchased a name brand or high cost HDMI cable as eventually, no matter the cost, they all eventually stop working. So far these have been just fine and are a good length if your box is not close to your TV connection. I highly recommend these for your high definition TV viewing needs. My husband has been using this to connect his new gaming laptop to our 65" Samsung 4K television and the picture and sound is perfect.

Began having issues with the cord about 3 months after purchase. Using it to connect a second monitor to my laptop. My laptop remains stationary so I do not plug/unplug the cable often. While having multiple screens open, certain portions of my laptop screen will freeze and make it impossible to continue working. I would restart my computer every time. I thought for a long time it was my monitor or my computer malfunctioning. Nope, I learned its the $7 cable. All you have to do is unplug and plug it back in. However, I now have to do this multiple times a day. Would not recommend this cable, especially if you plan to use it with items that are difficult to plug/unplug often.

I bought a pair of high-speed heavy braided ( 3' and 6' ) thinking bigger is better.....nope, not that I can tell. Now I'm still using the 6' braided for the long run to the TV from the AVR but I had to retire the 3' as it was way to stiff for a short run and wouldn't really even recommend braided for anything less than 12'. I went with the Amazon Basics because if they're willing to put their name on it they probably checked them out to avoid bad PR. So far everything I've bought with the Basics name on it I've been happy with including these cables.Hope that helps.

Good price, almost 2 cables for the price of 1.  Bought these to hook up a computer (Chromebook) to TV.  The 6 foot length is perfect for this task and the output quality is excellent.  The cables are well constructed and should last.

Bought this for our office...I have a coupon for these items, so I bought them as extras as they always seem to be disappearing. We only have a couple people in our work group and never enough HDMI cables - where do they go?!  I should’ve purchased more, these have already been used, so much for having “extras” around the office !

No nonsense HDMI cable. I've been using it for over a year. Might find cheaper, but this one hasn't given me any trouble and it wasn't expensive by any stretch of the imagination.AND FOR THOSE OF YOU WHOM PAY MORE THAN $15 FOR HDMI; you're being snake oiled. 1s and 0s don't care what the cable is comprised of.

When I connected my hd tv to my computer, my computer screen started to flicker and there was no picture on the tv. the tv also didn't recognize the cord. (the cord I was using was to short all I wanted was a longer one)Such a pain in the pain to return stuff. Is this the new Amazon? Cheap products that break easily or dont work?

These cables are garbage. The picture quality is terrible when connecting an iMac to a 3-way HDMI switch. It ends up with little green dots as artifacts in the picture, and sometimes there is no picture at all. I replaced this cable with a different brand of cable that has ferrite beads on each end, and now the picture is perfect. I would recommend that you look elsewhere for a higher-quality cable.

My ps4 pro was having handshake issues with its original PS4 provided UHD HDMI cable. So i bought a fancy expensive Belkin one and still had issues. As a last ditch resort before sending ps4 in for repairs i decide to buy this and it works perfectly. This is just as good or better than the way more expensive cables.

Does basic HDMI fine. With 4K it would cut our randomly for a few seconds about twice an hour. No a big deal until you are playing a game and the screen goes black for a few seconds RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF THAT GIANT ZERG!!!Will you have the same problem? Maybe, maybe not.  I have found at least 2 other people who report the same issue with this cable. So if you are planning to put a signal through it at full 4K resolution, do yourself a favor and spend the extra $6 for a Cable Matters cable right here on Amazon.

My old 4k vizio did not support 4:4:4 at 4k. New Samsung does. No problems at all 4:2:0 or 4:4:4 30hz. They "work" at 60hz, but get random popping in bitstreamed audio and random video blanks or tearing constantly.These are great for the price and will serve anyone with any consumer devices fine. They just cannot handle 23+gbps bandwidth necessary for 4:4:4 4k @ 60hz.

A decent cable for the price. Does the same job as more expensive ones do. If you go cheaper than this probably they wont really support 4k @60hz, but they may still be good at 1080p. Mine has no problems with my 4k TV @60hz with full RGB or YCbCr444 formats when I connect my PC. Make sure your PC supports HDMI 2.0 too.However, the first one I got had pixel flickering issues especially if there are a few bright pixels along with mostly dark regions. So I got a replacement from Amazon and new one has no such issues. I did not realize that the first time I use it so it maybe because that one was faulty or cable quality is not that high. No need to worry because it has lifetime warranty.

I love using this cable between my computer and my monitor, and between my TV and my game console. It has handled plenty of "plugging-in" and "un-plugging" and I have noticed no degradation in quality. Buy it!

I was having issues with my ps4 pro flickering my tv off briefly. Having a vizio home theatre e class, I googled and the first suggestion was to upgrade the hdmi cable to 2.0 . I searched and decided to try this pack. It was reasonably priced and if it didn't work I wouldn't be out a ton of money.I am happy to say it has fixed the problem. I no longer have the random black screens. Very happy with the purchase. Visually I see no difference between this and my other cable, but it fixed my black out problem.

Great product for the price!  Works as well as cords two to three times the price at the local Walmart.  Economical, yet gets the job done.  Fits perfectly in the computer and tv ports and instantly turns the tv  into a large screen monitor  Iwould not hesitate to buy more of these.

High Speed HDMI cable with ethernet by Amazon Basics.  This cable is made of nice heavy duty quality material.  Great for connecting a pc that receives wifi signal to an area of the house where the wifi won't normally reach.  Enables you to watch a TV in an area that just won't pick up the wifi.  Easy Peezy plug in HDMI hookup on both ends.  (One end into a laptap HDMI plug in and the other end into the TV with the HDMI plug in.  Love it!  Cable is round and about 3/8" thick.

For versatility, HDMI (as a video standard) is hard to beat.  Not only do most smart TVs support it, so do many, many monitors.  In fact, these days you should always keep an HDMI cable handy to connect to a TV or monitor, because the odds are high you'll visit a hotel room, conference room or other location that already has one.

Not as durable feeling as our other HDMI cables but does the job. We bought in 10ft length because we needed the extra length to be able to connect a blu-ray player to a television in front of our treadmill. The picture quality seems good so far and we are happy with it. It is just being used to stream blu ray discs to a 1080p television monitor. Decent cable for the price.

One thing I didnt like was the cube would lose connection to the TV like it wasn't plugged in and I had to keep unplugging and plugging back in the HDMI cable for it to recognize the signal again.I changed the HDMI cable to another premium brand (from Ebay!) and now it doesn't do that anymore.

There are certain products that there's not a lot to talk about. They either work or they don't. like safety pins or matches, cables can be judged by that simple binary choice: work or don't work.These work. I use them to connect my Chromebook to my TV. They work effectively. At 6', they are plenty long for the purpose. The connectors are no-nonsense and fit well at either end. No problems there. In short, this is a good product for the price.

Both cables black out the screen intermittently when using with Apple TV 4K. Error message afterward reads that the hdmi cable isn’t good enough. Product description says it would support 4K at 30 which is a lie. I ran a test on the Apple TV to verify if the cable would work and both failed.

I purchased this link to interface my Apple TV to my Television and I needed to see 4k substance and I was looking for 4k viable HDMI link and I discovered this with AmazonBasics marking, Im happy with the yield I got and getting a charge out of the 4k content.Disadvantages:

Making use of a long cable like this can greatly reduce clutter in your setups. I have this connected to my Xbox which then runs under and around my bed to a TV at the base of my bed, making it easy and neat to store the Xbox in a convenient location. Quality is very good and i have not noticed any input lag with this cable.

Was looking for a simple HDMI cable to run through the wall to TV. Did not realize that this particular cable was so unnecessarily bloated.  huge rubberized end pieces and cheap feeling jacket make these cables twice as difficult to run through walls and fish through firebreaks. As far as I can tell, there is no reason this cable needs to be this bulbous. Probably just an attempt to make them seem like they are higher gauge. Will avoid this garbage next time.

It arrived in a super time. It workes as advertised. These kind of things are hard to rate as there are no moving parts except the electrons bumping each other on the wires. HDMI cables work or they don't There is not much in the way to repair them if they don't. It is a throw-away thing if it comes to that.  Right now, I am quite happy. It will interface from my laptop to a mid-sized television, to show a video at a monthly meeting.
Too expensive for a single HDMI calble

I've ordered and tried THREE 10' cables and none of them worked to their full spec. Yes, they work for 4K just fine, but 4K *and* HDR wasn't supported. 2 of them just flicker with static and 1 didn't give any signal at all. I tried one at 3' and three at 6' cables and all 4 of those worked just fine (not the 10'). I assume is has to do with the length of cable and the signal start being lost. I also bought another brand at 10' and this worked just fine. http://a.co/24hlf6c
works like it should.Happy it does what it should.

Bought 3. Only two worked right out the box. One wasn't even 4K HDR compliant. Know this because when I used another HDMI from the 3, the signal showed up in 4K HDR. But then that HDMI was giving me issues. Constant flickering, signal would go in and out. Tested these HDMI cables with a PS4 Pro, XBOX One X, and a 4K capable PC running a GTX1080ti.  The last and 3rd HDMI worked great. No flickering, no signal cutting out on any of the 3 4K HDR capable devices. A week passed by, and you guessed it, flickering, signal cutting in and out. I ended up returning all three cables. Also did the test's with HDR turned off. I must have just received a bad batch of HDMi cables.

This  6 ft 2016 cable has been in my "spare" collection for some time.  I used it today with a new BenQ 1080p video projector.  The result was random flashes of light on the screen and some flickering.  I swapped it out, and tried a Cable Matters slim 15' cable.  The picture was perfect, steady, and no random flashes.  Projector stays; cable is tossed out.

Works good just for using a work computer or something. I wouldn’t use it for home theater or for something where visuals are important like gaming. Budget cable for the less intensive operations. Works great for just watching TV or drafting word documents. Build quality is very nice for the price

At 15 feet I didn't think "high end" quality mattered much, but I was pleasantly surprised by this "cheap" cable.  No complaints.  I will buy "Amazon Basics" cables again.Not sure why the review asks for "picture quality" and "sound quality" on an HDMI signal cable--either you have the signal or you don't.  It's not analog.
Total fail for 4K gaming on an HDTV.  Only supported 4K@30HZ and limited to YCBCR4:2:0, which is unacceptable in my book.  Returning this product and upgrading to a higher-quality cable.

I don't have cable but I have internet so I wanted to watch movies and stuff from the internet on my tv.  I'm not sure if I have a smart tv and I didn't have time to figure it out, but I did have HDMI on both the tv and computer so I ordered this as a quick and cheap solution.  Quality cable and it does exactly what I needed.  Very happy.  Now if I could figure out if my tv is smart that would be great.

I ordered 2 packs of 2 HDMI 2.0 cables from Amazon. They work rather well. I am using them for a PlayStation 4, a WiiU, an Apple TV 4th gen, and a late 2012 Mac Mini, with of course a 4K Sony Bravia TV 2016 Model with the upscale feature. So far the HDMI for the PS4 makes things look a bit better, sure it's just an HDMI cable but coming from version 1.3, this version 2.0 does the trick very nicely. One last thing I have to mention is, that I like the black color of the cable which matches the back of the TV very nicely.-Amazon delivered very promptly. I literally ordered this on a Saturday and received them 2 days later on Monday, without 2 day shipping.

My Mac laptop screen cracked  and is unreadable & I didn't want to spend $800 to replace it.  I ordered a monitor on Amazon that came with cable but would have needed a converter.  With this simple cord all you do is attach one end to your mac and the other to the monitor and you are immediately ready to go as the laptop screen immediately appears on the monitor.  It really could not be any simpler.

Already, the first cable is occasionally flickering to black with no apparent cause. I have the second one still if it becomes too troublesome, but I'm not very hopeful about that one either... You really get what you pay for. I wouldn't recommend it as a primary cable, but for a second monitor for casual web browsing or something not so important, I'd 100% recommend it if you can tolerate the occasional flickering.

I bought a 2-pack of the 3 foot cables because it was the same price for both as for one. One of the cables worked fine, but the other didn't work with my DVD player or with my Roku ultra. I got pretty random errors, such as flickering between static and video, or it would work for a while before saying No Video. So if you are getting weird errors, try a different cable!

I picked up a couple of these AmazonBasics cables to connect a laptop and projector for a family shindig a while back. They have nice gold-plated connectors, connect securely, and worked great. They seem quite nicely made overall -- smooth and of a good weight. We have one connecting theThese are great cables for a terrific price. I'll be buying these for any other HDMI cables I need.

I have a TV in a detached garage... and I wanted to extend my FireTV so it would be closer to to the house for th best signal.  I simply got an AmazonBasics HDMI Female to Female Coupler Adapter and this cable... and now I have the best signal I ever had.Simple solution at a great price!

I bought this cable to connect from my BenQ monitor to my laptop and my desktop. The hdmi end doesn't fit snugly into the hdmi ports on either of my computers. It's loose, so when i bump the wire or mildly brush up against it with my leg it shuts the connection off to the monitor. Gave it three stars cuz it does work but not in a place where the wires can be touched.

Bought another popular but cheaper HDMI from Amazon. It didn’t work so I got these instead. Naturally, they work flawlessly and are built with a much sturdier cord and have gold plating. I’m happy, as the usual with Amazon Basics. Starting to wonder if Amazon has a bunch of secret scientist/spies at this point though...

This was exactly what I needed.  The quality is good and not one of those cheap pieces of junk I've seen before.  Would order again if I need another one.  I used it to connect a laptop to a TV to watch a video I had made of my daughters high school band competition.  The picture and sound were just like the laptop, no loss that I could detect.

You know, there's not a lot to say when it comes to HDMI cords but honestly the Amazon Basics brand has consistently been my go to for cables and I wanted to share my experience with them. I've purchased a dozen or so HDMI cables (they always mysteriously disappear) and they all work magnificently... and for such a low price too!  I cringe whenever I see people buy expensive Monster brand HDMI cables. I send everyone I know to Amazon Basics HDMI cables.

Good product and works well. But I couldn’t use it so had to return. If you want to know read ahead.It seems like if you already have another monitor connected to your laptop through VGA, you cant add one more monitor with HDMI Adapter. Either one with work in that case even when both are connected and preference somehow is given automatically to the VGA connector. So I got myself a mini d-sub cable instead which works nicely.

I bought this to share an HDMI input between an X-box and a dvd player. Well, this switcher works ONLY if both devices are on at all times, which makes it useless for that purpose. Even if you decide to put up with having both devices on, the x-box will time out for inactivity and shut itself off, at which point your DVD signal will also disappear. I am returning it and will look for a passive switch, if one exists.
it took my moms old computer and made it hook up to the tv perfect

My stock on backup hdmi cables ran out and would need a new one soon anyway.  Cheap and effective solution.  More often then naught someone has bought a new product,  needs help setting up only to find they have no hdmi cable and local stores are charging way too much of a mark up. Having some cables on hand is very helpful.  Will buy again as need arises.

I use this cord to run a line from a projector to my computer, which I need to have by the wall because of the short speaker wires. I almost exclusively buy HDMI cables from Amazon because they just work flawlessly for a great price. The cable feels sturdy in your hands, and I didn’t have much trouble unraveling it. Can’t think of any drawbacks, it’s just adequately perfect!

The cables are as described, 10' long and well-protected by end caps and wire coating. However, when I replaced my previous HDMI cable (the previous standard, without Ethernet sharing), the ARC feature from my Samsung 4K TV to my Harmon Kardon A/V Receiver kept going in-and-out. Sometimes it would say it was connected, but the volume (and other) buttons would not actually change the volume. Other times I scanned to connect, but the TV could not find any devices. I tried several different setups over the course of about five hours with no luck. It kept cutting in and out, or disappearing altogether.I removed the AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI cable and replaced it with a non-AmazonBasics cable from the previous standard. I have not had an issue since with the ARC feature. [Edit: See Below.] The other AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI cable is still hooked up from my receiver to my PS4, and I have no problems using the HDMI Link between my TV through the receiver and to the PS4. This cable works great, unless you want to use the ARC feature to return audio from your TV to your receiver.

It worked fine at first, but it does not work well at 4k 30hz. It will cause an issue at times and the cable connector seems to be getting loose.The cable is to thick and stiff. This makes it hard to position and turn around to plug in. I guess that would be a good thing to though.

I bought this prior to going off to college so I could connect my laptop to the tv and it works great! The picture quality is great and I have no issue with the computer connecting to the TV.  I am not very tech savvy but this was easy to use.  For Macs you must purchase a thunderbolt to be able to connect HDMI.

This cable is unnecessarily huge! it's so fat.  Shielding is important for analog signals but come on man this is a pretty standard digital signal and I don't think 15ft is very far to worry too much. I guess you can almost see it from the picture, but it seems a heck of a lot bigger in person.  geesh.  The Amazon 6ft was really nice and I was hoping it would be the same but it's not. One nice thing is that it is a nice flexible material like the 6th one.

The picture was VERY stuttery and almost unwatchable on my laptop. I was watching formula one streamed from a web browser. Switched to using the cable that came with my roku and the problem was eliminated. If you’re doing anything with a lot of detail or high refresh rate I’d look elsewhere.

I got a small, Vizio used HDTV from a relative to use in the attic with my indoor training bike.  I bought a 6 ft cable to get the HDMI output from my FIOS set top box to the TV.  TV recognized the input, but the TV said no signal.  I tried the cable on my downstairs TV, and it didn't work on that TV, either.  That TV just showed various spots and zags of many colors.  Amazon sent a second cable 2 days later, and the 2nd cable works just fine.  Thanks for the lifetime guarantee.  I took off a star for the faulty first cable.

Just got these yesterday hooked them onto my PC and soon after I leave my computer it restarts  it has done this over 3 times so far. I don't know what it is wity this cables. I bought the 25 ft. Was forced to buy another brand we will see.. never had this problem before

This is not the first AmazonBasics product purchased and these didn't disappoint either.  The price per cable and the length(s) offered were perfect for the application and have proven reliable.  They installed easily and work well and with various electronics used (i.e. Blu Ray players, displays, computers, etc.)

Bought this because I needed to hook up another TV with an HDMI cable and I could not find the extra one I had on hand, it will eventually appear. LOL It does exactly what it supposed to do and works as well as any cable that you may buy in a physical store. Great product and definitely would buy again and would recommend! Very satisfied with purchase and product!!

I picked up a couple packs of these to connect HDMI decoders to TVs for streaming video. I feel like 3' cables (in general) are too short for most applications and I would have normally bought 6-10'. Since the decoders were all mounted within close proximity I felt ok going with a shorter length. They were a great value and the quality is good.

Bought a 10' and 15' cable.  The 10' works fine, but the 15' would not support 4k HDR with HDCP 2.2 coming from a Sony PS4 Pro.  Specifically bought these cables because the PS4 Pro was dropping sync with my LG OLEDC7 on my older cables.  With the 15' I could only maintain sync for a few seconds before it  dropped out and started flashing and showing gray noise.  I also tried another one of my older, shorter cables and it worked.  Perhaps either the PS4 or OLED doesn't like longer cables when pushing full data rate, but I'm only finding stability with cables 10' or shorter.

I had a flickering problem with my blue ray player. So, I tried several things, starting with cleaning of the lens, getting it away from other electronics, changing video settings on the player and the TV. Since none of these fixed the problem, I hooked up several other DVD players to the TV, and they had the same flickering problem. So, finally I checked the blue ray player on a different HDMI cable, which worked well for my computer. Presto magic, that fixed the problem.  So I bought the Amazon Basics HDMI cable for the blue ray player and the blue ray works fine now.

Got this cable to hook up my gaming pc to my 4K tv. Worked great, delivering at a full 60hz refresh rate...up until now.I haven't touched anything, but now it's on the fritz, flashing weird colors and sometimes not even displaying. I've tested each of the components, and it's for sure the chord. Very disappointed.

The cable does the job well but it's hard to bend at the connector and seems much thicker than necessary to do the job, compared to shorter cables.  If I had to buy over again, I'd pick a different one, maybe cloth-covered.  Also I'd buy a shorter one since this is longer than I thought I needed.  If a thick and heavy cable doesn't bother you, it's a good buy and a good price.

Been using these babies for months now and got one for a friend too. So far so good, the only issue I've experienced is a mild delay in things registering on the other monitor I've connected this to... issue gets worse when I have a lot of things going on. Can't complain too much though, these haven't failed me yet and seemed well worth it!

I needed a device that could switch between our PC multimedia and PS4. The challenge was that I run audio through a mixer so I needed the RCA outs provided in this product. Very easy to hook up and am impressed that the device senses when a device is turned on or off and automatically switches to another device that is attached to it.

Perfect Cable for my build.  It runs from my Pioneer audio video receiver up the wall and across the ceiling to my Epson Home Cinema 2150 projector.  High quality build and full signal and wonderful picture.  Keep in mind, because of its length, it is a little thicker than a regular HDMI cable and could affect your run because of that.  I was able to capture it in a nice normal white cable track with the power cord on my ceiling.  Great product Amazon, thank you!

In our house we have been experiencing problems in using a HDMI hub as a middle device for a multitude of services that connect to our TV.  For a few months I have been playing with the connections and device attempting to tackle the signal problem with our TV.  I replaced the cable between the hub and TV with the Amazon HDMI cable and the problems we had no longer exist.  We are very happy to find this, it solved our problem and saved us $$$$.  I was worried it was our TV or the HUB.  We highly recommend these cables, they are durable and connect very well.

I'm not sure if it's because the chord is so long or what, but it wouldn't work properly. It would transmit to my wall mounted tv but it was grainy and not in color. I will definitely be returning it. It's unfortunate because I really need it but not if it doesn't work.

These cables work perfectly for my Roku ultra and my Samsung 4K TV. I had a cheap generic cable at first and the Roku couldn't do 4:2:2 HDR. These cheap cables just work. I do wish there were even shorter ones available for a neater setup. The way my TV works, I only need about one foot long cables. The TV has a little box with all the inputs and outputs that's connected by a cable. So my devices are just inches away from where they plug in.
Great cable especially for the price. Not sure why anyone would pay more for an hdmi cable when this one gets the job done perfectly!

The cable worked for a year and five months. One day it started showing a lot of static in the picture. At first I thought it was the Roku I was using.  I tried a Blu-ray player and had the same issue. I ended up ordering a fiber optic hdmi cable and that solved my problem. I don’t know if it’s worth the hassle of trying to get a replacement cable from amazon.

This product is recommended, which should be a joke. I feel as if all recommended amazon products fail or never reach the description’s promises. This product will not support 4K HDMI. I tried both HDMI’s shipped and they both fail, especially when using Netflix. Tried on Xbox, PS, and PC. Picture flashes, freezes, etc when trying to process. I changed settinga to 30hz refresh and still failed. Really only works for 1080p. Side note: I asked my cable provider in site for 2 10 ft cables (gave for free) and both did support the HDR content.

This cable is very thick, the head on the end of it is no larger than the other hdmi cables I have despite its appearance, and it always works with my 4k DirecTV box unlike the one I was using before which would work on 1080 channels, but not on the 4k ones. Amazon knows what they are doing and you can't go wrong with amazon basics.

I needed to rewire my sound system and the many, MANY different things plugged into the receiver. As I unwired things, I realized I have a huge assortment of different lengths/types of HDMI cables, so decided to replace them all. These worked great, all the cables fit tightly and securely. I bought both 3' and 6' cables.

Amazing cables at an affordable price. Tested with 4K HDR and Dolby Vision. Works with Apple TV too. I have this HDMI cable going from my Denon AV receiver to my LG OLED TV and all my devices hooked to my AV receiver using this HDMI cable as well. Everything works great. Don't listen to the reviews that said Dolby Vision doesn't work on the Apple TV. They probably didn't set up their AV receiver and TV settings properly. The TV and the AV receiver has a setting that is listed as HDMI Deep Color or HDMI Enhanced that you will need to enable for HDR and Dolby Vision. Also it is prefered to set up the match settings under the video settings for the Apple TV.

I bought this repackaged from the warehouse and it works like a charm! Perfect in material, picture and sound quality. I have this hooked up from my desktop in my office to my TV in the living room so that I can stream my yoga into the Living Room.  Works perfect!  Would definitely purchase products such as this again from Amazon!
I've had this cable for months now and I use it a least 3 times a week. No problem and works great. I like that it's long and reach across the room😃

4K HDR, or Deep Color as it is called in my TV doesn't work with my PS4 Pro and LG 55UH7700-UB. I bought a 10ft version in order to put my PS4 further from the TV as the bundled cable is only 6ft long. With HDMI ULTRA HD Deep Color setting enabled for the port it keeps flickering and shows black screen most of the time. Turning HDR and Deep Color settings to Off on PS4 doesn't help - the PS4 still tries to output HDR singal as I was able to notice in the PS4 video output information screen during short moments when the signal did go through. With Deep Color disabled on the TV it works fine.

We have a Vizio 32" TV that hangs above the fireplace in our Living Room, we do not yet have an electrical outlet behind our TV. We also did not want to mount our Xfinity X1 Cable TV unit on the wall. Xfinity only gives you a basic 4' HDMI cable. We needed 25' feet of HDMI cable to run through the wall and into our nearby X1 Cable TV unit. These cords are much thicker than what normally comes with you TV, Cable Box or from a shelf at Walmart. They don't have "long ends" which means they mount very easily between a TV and the wall. I will by these again for other TVs.

I bought the original cord 2 years ago and it worked fine until about 2 weeks ago, when suddenly, it stopped working. It has a Limited Lifetime Guarantee, so I called Amazon and asked about what I need to do to replace it. Before I knew it, the representative informed me that a replacement had been ordered and I received it the next day!So this is one of the reasons I buy from Amazon!

I bought them because I was still using the one I bought in 2008 for my first “HD” TV. Having just bought a 4K TV, and not wanting to get sucked in to these overpriced cables, I did my research, and determined I needed to get a “high speed” HDMI cable, and, these did the job.Do I notice a cleaner picture?  Not really, but what I do notice is the “picture” shows up quicker when changing channels.

These cables are much higher quality than those sold at discount shops, Walmart, etc. and are priced very reasonably. I haven't tested whether they go beyond the basic HDMI spec to support 4K at 60fps, but for my uses (HDTV and laptop to monitor) they've been working nicely and they seem to be very sturdy. Definitely recommend this to anyone who's skeptical of the low price because they've been working perfectly. I will be looking for other AmazonBasics products in the future!

I've used this for over a year, and I am definitely impressed with its performance. I was kinda reluctant to buy this thinking it wouldn't be as good as other branded ones. However, I am glad that I didn't fall prey to my own stupid notion. Anyway, I use this cable to hook up my Mac to my TV, and it works perfect. Another thing I really love about this cable is its flexibility that makes is easy to roll for storage.

Another great cable from Mediabridge. Perfect length and flexibility to connect an Apple TV that is mounted to the back of my Toshiba TV using the TotalMount - Apple TV Universal Mounting System (see photo). Also used a Monoprice HDMI Port Saver (Male to Female) - 270 Degree connector for the HDMI input on the back of the TV. From the photo you can also see the Mediabridge coaxial cable connected to the back of my Toshiba TV. As for the image and sound quality coming out of my TV after connecting the Apple TV using the Mediabridge HDMI cable, I don't think it could be any better!!!

There isn't much to say. Either a HDMI cable works, or it doesn't. This is a long one for specialty installs, and it does the job. Picture and Audio quality is what it should be. Happy thus far. Packaging is simple, but nothing more is really needed as long as it works.~ Kort

Literally the first day that I got it, it didn’t work. Mind you, I opened it right out of the bag and connected my ps4 to my t.v. Right away, the picture isn’t clear, there is static, and the sound isn’t working all the way. So, I went to get a replacement, but out of the blue, the HDMI Cable starts working perfectly, so I canceled the replacement. Now, it’s back to how it was, not working, and now I can’t get the replacement without returning the item. I have to return the item, with a refund. This whole HDMI Cable just caused such a hassle all night long. I have never had to experience this ever when ordering from Amazon, and I have ordered an HDMI Cable from here before. Just a bad experience overall.
I bought this cable to project my laptop screen to a 42 inch TV. The cable is very thick and seems very durable. Works perfectly for my case of use.

Amazon Basic cables are pretty amazing honestly, they are firm, strong, tough, and work, even my cats have issues playing with these ones!, they last a good while against the kittys needs to chew on cables.When I say firm I mean they are easy to put into the slots because of how tough the material is and they don't wobble around like other cables do when trying to plug erm in.

I specifically bought this HDMI cable because it says in the product description that it supports 4k resolution at 60fps. When this arrived in the mail i hooked it up to my Roku and says this HDMI cable is NOT compatible with 4k 60fps, and can only handle 30fps. Inaccurate product description.
Like the connector ends seems very durable especially because our kids unplug them to move them aroundAm going to order more soon

These cables seem to transport my computer video signals from the CPU to the monitors with ease, and they look great doing it!  Build quality of the cables seems to be very good.These days I look for AmazonBasics products anytime I am shopping for anything and have yet to be disappointed.

This AmazonBasics HDMI Cable is well built; priced right, and the sound quality is adequate.  I recently built an i5 CPU computer for my nieces.  I bought this cable for a monitor which is 2K and the picture quality is good and the sound is good too.  It was made well as far as I can tell and it handles the 2K signal well.  The price is great too, and being an AmazonBasics cable - It's a great cable!!!

I was looking for a HDMI cord but didnt want to pay a small fortune for it. This cord is perfect. The 3 foot one was all I needed as it only needed to reach the back of the tv from the roku box directly below it. And Im so tired of all the long cords everywhere so wanted a smaller cord to avoid that exact problem. This cord is great the ports are very good quality as is the cord material. This is not a cheap made cord even though it is inexpensive to purchase. If you are looking for almost any lenght of HDMI cord check these out you won't be dissapointed. Also it comes with a lifetime warranty as well so added bonus there.

Conforms to HDMI 2.0 and HDCP 2.2, quality materials, decent length, comes in a pack of 3, and a GREAT price.  Really not much else to say about these.  I tested all three on my Roku Ultra and each one worked fine.  No bad eggs as far as I can tell and at the price they're being sold for you kinda expect there to be a dud mixed in.  Solved my "HDCP unauthorized" problem on my Roku Ultra so I'm happy.

Bought these cables to replace my old HDMI because they were cheap and highly rated. My tv picture kept going out every couple of days and I thought it was my Xfinity X1 box. I noticed every time my dog would bump into the cable it would make the picture on my tv go out. So I got this new HDMI cable and zero problems with the picture since I got it.
I have had such good experiences with AmazonBasics electronics! This is no different, is a quality product I have had no issues with.

I really didn't know what Apple TV did until I wanted to watch a sports event that was only shown through a program on FloSports, through Apple TV. So I purchased this and true to most Apple products, I plugged it in and it worked. I am addicted to Netflix and Hulu and now it is so easy to watch.

I have connected my Yamaha 4920 (4K Ultra HD video with HDCP 2.2 compatibility) and Sony XBR65X850C (65-Inch 4K Ultra HD 3D) with this cable and so far it's working as expected.1. So far I've connected only a HD source to my Yamaha receiver which is perfectly being relayed to the TV with this cable. So no issues there.

The key idea with this brand and its products is value. You're receiving quality and performance that matches or exceeds that of higher priced offerings. I bought this to connect my TV to my soundbar. As expected, I have no complaints and would buy again without hesitation.

Nothing but flickering and blackout problems.  Not just me but a huge Apple forum thread on this.  The answer is the Belkin cable for the 4K Apple TV.  Yeah, $40, just do it.  I tried all sorts of ways to avoid that and wasted a lot of time for nothing, as have many others.

Ive had issues with a few cables that intermittently cut in and out. Has not happened once with this cable, at least so far, and i am running 4k hdr. Ive paid much more for cables, so even if it does wear out or start to fail, at this price, its no big deal, because ive already seen that paying more money doesn't mean it will work better or last longer. analog signals were prone to interference, digital is not, so it simply works or it doesn't

Really the 15ft length is super thick and honestly embarrassing to hold in my hand.  Its almost like were going backwards instead of advancing cable technology.  Anyway just way to heavy and rigid for use in todays television hdmi ports.  Felt like it was going to break the port on the TV.
Thickest HDMI cord I have ever seen, extremely well made! A bit on the intense side but it will last us a lifetime. Heavy duty

I bought this cable as an upgrade for my home theater PC.  I was not able to set 4K resolution with HDR with my previous HDMI cable.  After plugging the new cable into the PC, I was able to set 4K resolution and choose the extra 10-bit or 12-bit color depth from the Nvidia control panel.

I had purchased the splitter to be able to use my dvr/dvd  recorder, as my t.v. only had TWO HDMI ports, not realizing the cable was a separate purchase, and DID NOT come with the splitter.  After getting this cable, everything works as it should and I am thrilled having my dvd/dvr player, BACK in the living room again, with our NEW T.V.

The picture quality is excellent. No issues going from the Amazon Fire TV Cube through an Onkyo receiver and then to the TV with 4K streaming shows.  Also works well with DirecTV/AT&T newest 4K satellite receiver.  Previous, older, HDMI cable appeared to have color degradation.

Didn’t realize they had a new version of this cable available until after I purchased it however this one works great. The new one I think just has a braided cord and comes in a few different colors. Got it hooked up to a Nintendo Switch and the image quality/game play is good.

I have a 4k Ultra 55" Samsung TV. I've had intermittent cases of the TV's picture and sound going blank and I couldn't figure out exactly why this was occurring. After doing a bit of research, one of the possible options was for me to swap out the old HDMI 1.0 cable to the newer, updated HDMI 2.0 cables. Guess what? It resolved my problem! The issue was the HDMI cable from the cable set top box to the TV. Once I swapped it out with thise cable, I'm now set and good to go! I've sinced swapped out the other HDMI cables and replaced it with these.PROS: Quality

So I got this for my PC running an NVDIA GeForce 1080 on a 65” flat screen. Everything was perfect until this morning when my screen was registering a signal but no picture was presented. After several different troubleshooting methods I pirated the HDMI I was using for my Xbox and it ran flawlessly. I checked back to see that I’ve had this cable less than a year. June 9th of 2019. Even a high use HDMI cable should be good for over a year I’d think, right?
Previously spent more money on other hdmi cables that were causing delays. These cables are so much better, faster, and less expensive.

I recently upgraded to an LG 4K Blu-ray player and purchased the AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable to complete the set-up. I have not watched any 4K movies - disc or streaming - at this time. BUT I am very pleased with the picture quality when watching a TV show or watching a Blu-ray movie.I will update this review in a few months after watching 4K content.
Exactly as described, well made. My only complaint is that the "head" is VERY thick** (that's what she said) and it's a pain the you-know-what to plug into my TV because of that.

Just a standard HDMI cable. You don;t need to spend a lot of money on these. They either work or don't and pretty cable covers and fancy chemical names for the wires inside make no difference. Seriously, paying $100 for a cable will get you nothing better than a $20 cable. It may be thicker but again, they either work or don't. It's digital signals, not analog.

You can't beat these cables. I bought these to replace some older HDMI cables and I can't believe how much better the picture is with these cables. These are actually better then a monster brand HDMI cable that I have and they cost a fraction of what the monster brand cables cost.

This cable failed on me in less than a year. Completely flaked out and stopped working. I found it hard to believe but after a trip to the repair shop and testing my PS4 and the cable, we determined it was a faulty cable. I'm so surprised. But there you have it.

These are great cables. I’ve had two for a while, and recently got a new receiver with more HDMI inputs on it, so I decided to go ahead and replace all of my HDMI with these Amazon Basics cables.Picture quality is great, sound is great, and I now don’t have to worry about the age or quality of the random cables I had been using.

Great value for the money arrived quickly and when I realized that I ordered a spare cable I approached Amazon and asked to return the product, but Amazon asked me to keep the product and even refunded me for it. So kudos to Amazon and the way they treat their customers

We recently bought a new TV and wanted to watch our DVDs on it without buying a DVD player. I bought this cable and hooked the laptop up to the TV, and it worked great. I saw a similar cable (but two feet shorter) at Target for twice the price, so this is a great value.

I purchased this for my son to replace an HDMI cable that broke.  This is holding up really well after several weeks of use.  I found this to be a good price so I decided to give this AmazonBasics brand a try and so far I am very pleased with the quality of this product.  I also wanted an HDMI cable that was long enough so it could easily reach his electronic equipment so this 6-foot cable works out great. I will update this review if I encounter any problems with this cable after prolonged use.

Works fine.Note: I don't know the cause but I did get intermittent black screens on my apple tv 4k when running 4k HDR content. I know theoretically 18gbps is supposed to be enough, but I switched to some HDMI 2.1 cables that provide 48 gbps. The 2.1 cables completely eliminated the black screens.

So this thing is an HDMI cable, I am told its gold plated and therefore works better with 4k but if I am being honest with myself I see no difference. Its exactly as described in the tag and plays video from my amazon TV in 4k or ultra HD or whatever they are calling it now just fine. HDR works fine from a Netflix stream as well, I am just tired of admiring colors (mainly purple) in Jessica Jones at this point.
Not bad at this price. Price could have been less.Do facing few issues with UHD videos.Will keep an eye on that. Might be laptop issue. It’s automatically getting blank then coming up.

I bought a 25 foot cable and it never worked.  Not only that, but this code now shows up on my TV, and if I scan it it leads me to a “not secure” website with a Chinese URL or an app with a weird name and a non-sensical description.  I am mystified and suspicious.

Tried a couple of high end (read expensive) high speed HDMI cables to push 4K/60 from my receiver to my projector.  At 25 feet the expensive cables either failed to work or would stop working after operating for a short period of time.  This cable has been working perfectly since installation with no issues.  What a bargain!

This cable is working well and was quite a bargain for the price. It’s set up in a way which puts minimal stress on the cable so I hope it will keep working over time. I’ve actually been quite happy with all the amazon basics products I’ve purchased so far. They tend to be no frills but do what they’re supposed to do.

I also can vouch for true 4k at 60hz and full range or 444. I am running an Nvidia GTX 1070 outputting to a Hisense 55h8c. Keep in mind, on many TV's there are only a few ports meeting HDMI 2.0 specs. My TV is a perfect examples. Believe it or not, the HDMI 3&4 ports are the high speed HDMI ports. 1&2 only meet the 1.4 specs.I was stuck at 30hz... when I swapped my input to #3 HDMI and changed my HDMI setting in the TV to high speed, bam! 60hz native resolution at 4k.

I purchased a used Apple TV to see if I liked it enough to buy the newer 4k version.  I needed the HDMI cable as part of the install.I’m always looking for a good price, but leary to go too cheap on a product.  Based on the reviews, I shouldn’t have been concerned.  Great product at a great price.  Very happy with my purchase.

It seems like you ALWAYS need HDMI cords for SOMETHING! Amazon Basics has never left me disappointed so far. These multi packs are great, because if you're anything like me, there WILL be a day that you will need another one. Ours are still going strong after 2 years or more.

I am not sure why, but this cable creates a strobe effect on the shows when watching.  I can literally see the massive difference in smoothness of play between an older cable I use on another TV vs. using the Amazon cable.  The strobing is so annoying that it makes the shows unwatchable.

Great to have a REAL product. Sure seems like "Amazon Basics" is destined to be a "go-to-first" supplier of quality products. Everything I have purchased from them has been 100% SPOT ON in every respect. I don't agree with JB"s politics but he darn sure understands good business. THANK YOU.

I was successfully able to use HDMI cable to link my laptop to my TV.  The cord is also flexible enough that I don't get annoyed trying to adjust it.  My other cable was too stiff and liked to reorient itself.  Because of that, this seems to be a much better cable.

Good, thick cables. We needed them to replace one that had the end ripped out from an accident with our dog one of our consoles (the dog and console sre fine!). These work just as well as what we had. No complaints. The price is great for a set of 3. We're happy to have backups

I replaced a fancier looking cable from my desktop tower to a monitor with this cable, and the image stopped tearing and blinking, stable as rock now. I used to not believe in cable quality, after all, a wire is a wire, but yes, there is a difference in quality. These cables are quite decent.

I used this 10' cable to connect my Yamaha (TSR-7850) receiver to my Samsung (UN65NU740DFXZA) TV. It worked fine for my Direct TV Genie box, but did not transmit my LG Blueray (UBKC90) player's 60Hz 4k video signal to the TV. When I switched the Blueray to a 24Hz signal, it worked. Replaced the cable with a Mediabridge ULTRA Series HDMI Cable and all is good.

I bought this HDMI cable to connect my laptop to the overhead projector in my classroom - it was exactly what I needed. Worked reliably, great picture quality, and so far has held up great through a full year of getting plugged in and unplugged and stepped on by teenagers and rolled over with an AV cart.

I searched for the most "bang" for the buck and found it in the AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable, 10 Feet, 1-Pack ----- PERIOD!Yes, you can pay more AND you can find more IMPRESSIVE looking HDMI cables but they wont work any better!
The cable will not work with my Roku Ultra. I keep getting a HDCP error whenever I want to load any content on Plex.The only plus side is the 15ft cable will reach anywhere.

This cable is really good but there are some flaws. First the ends of it the rubber is really thick so it won't fit in to some HDMI ports. Second the cable is a little too thick so some hard to reach ports you may not be able to get to without bending the cable significantly. Other than that I haven't had and problems with picture quality or anything so pretty good overall.

Its a basic cable. Long enough that I can seat on the couch with my laptop without stretching out the cable.After using it for 3 months one side of the connecter is bent a little bit. But then it was because my TV is a little close to my wall so the cable needs to be bent. Overall it works without any hiccups.

This is definitely a high-quality, thick gauge – consequently large diameter cable.  The picture quality is great, which I understand is due to the larger gauge high quality components used to manufacture this cable. Unfortunately, I run it across the room to the TV,  and it is probably about a quarter inch in diameter and black in color. It looks like a very tough cable, although I have not abused it in anyway.

We wanted an extra long cord. It delivered! But it's also at least 3x thicker than all of our other cords so it's not easy to wrap up and put away and is a little bulky to use. It seems like an industrial strength cord? Just be wary if you are looking for a normal cord that's just a bit longer.

When you order "AmazonBasics", you expect to get.... the basic. That's exactly what I paid for and it is exactly what I received. The item is as describes and after a month of use, seems to work very well. It has no problem transferring audio and video from my Mac to a TV - works like a $40 would. I don't usually buy "off brand" electronic related material but when it comes to HDMI cables it is hard to find a better deal. I would highly recommend these cables to anyone looking for both value AND performance.

I was needing a couple of HDMI cables to set up a 3 monitor PC. This package of 3 was a good price even though I already had one cable.  I was wanting 10 feet cables to have extra length so I can route the cables for cable management. I was not using sound out of the monitors so I did not rate that. The cables feel like made of high-quality materials and will last a long time.

nice heavy cables that should last a good ling time.  I needed the 8' cables, and they are exactly 8'These have been heavily reviewed so I really can't add much to the others comments.  I don't think I've ever gone wrong with an Amazon Basics product, and I'm happy to see them expand into more and more product categories.

Bought some expensive “High quality, 4k cert with some 18plus something speed” hdmi’s from other store” and did not see any difference from my old broken one. So i went ahead and got this one, and im glad i did. Very affordable and still functions like high tier hdmi.

You can always trust Amazon Basics for high quality "stuff" at very reasonable prices. We recently bought a 4K TV and with the new technology just hitting the market, I went for the HDMI 2.0 which is required to watch 4K content above 30hz and having backwards compatibility means that no matter what TV/receiver/satellite box/etc. you have, getting the HDMI 2.0 is the smartest thing to do, because right now it might not make a difference for most people, but give it a year or two and HDMI 1.4 will be obsolete.

One of the plastic casings at either broke along the seem and now the plug is floating free with the wire connectors exposed.  I tried to put the casing back on, but the plug seemed bent.  I had another backup, a sturdier HDMI with the braided cable.  I put this one away as a spare but likely will throw out.

When I replaced a 6 foot Amazon Basics HDMI cable, with a 4K HDR HDMI cable, I saw a significant improvement in the picture quality.  I immediately ordered new 3 foot 4K HDR HDMI cables to replace the Amazon Basic cables that go between my UHD 4K devices (i.e., ROKU, Apple TV, & Blu-ray Player) and my UHD 4K Denon Receiver. (Note:  My TV is a 65" Sony Bravia 4K UHD.)  Amazon Basics cables are a great value buy.  But, if you want maximum picture quality, buy cables that are HDR/UHD capable.

These cables work quite well so far, transmitting clear signals where other cables have failed, but holy mackerel, they are enormously thick and not very pliable. They are heavier and and more stiff than some heavy-duty exterior grade extension cords that I have. If you have limited space to run your cables or are worried about pulling on a fragile HDMI socket, these might not be the best choice.

I'm of the belief that there are diminishing returns with AV cables. You can get monster-type cables, but are they really much better than super-cheap cables? I don't think so, but rather than find out, I go middle of the road and am quite happy with the results.

Bought the cable for my pc to monitor.  Works great.  Not tested on a 4K TV at 60FPS.  Not sure what high speed means.  Best to try the cables and see if they work for your application.Would live to see manufactures state their cable is certified for HDMI 2.0 which requires 18GBS bandwidth for 4K at 60FPS.

DO NOT BUY! They worked fine for a few months, but now they are resulting in signal dropouts with some of my devices (and it's worse with higher resolution video signals). After extensive troubleshooting I found that simply replacing these with some of my older cables (nothing fancy, just no-name but with larger gauge wire) the signal dropouts were eliminated.

AmazonBasics makes an incredible product. This is a great cable. It is on the heavier side. So, keep that in mind when working on your cable management. I specifically used this cable to run from my PC to my Samsung TV. I use my TV as my main display when gaming and my second monitor to view things such as emails, Twitch, and any other relevant information.

Amazon basic cables must have some secret that other manufacturers don't know about because they are the best cables for the cheapest price.  The cable came packaged well and in great quality.  The picture and sound quality are excellent.  The cable is finely made and holds up with all of the major brands.  But the best part is that it is the thrifty buy!  Big box stores will charge you 3x as much for the same cable.  This is an incredible deal and I will never buy anything but Amazon Basic cables.

10 feet of hdmi cable is good size, not too long not too short. I used this to plug my mac to my big screen tv and had no issues.  The cable is flexible yet durable and easy to travel with since that' s what I do a lot of!

Good quality with tight connections.  As I always say, spending $50-$100 on high end HDMI cables is completely pointless.  Don't ever let a BIG BOX employee try to sell you those by saying they have better picture quality.  It's a lie  HDMI is digital  which means the data is nothing but 0's and 1's or true false or on/off or high voltage low voltage.  As long as the signal gets across the cable you can't make it any better.

Does NOT work with 4K video. Video plays back in slow motion when playing and with dropped frames as well. Audio also doesn't work. Content I'm trying to stream is from my computer to my TCL 4K HDR 10 bit panel tv. It does work with my other hdmi cables though. These "latest standard" cables purchased September 1st, 2017 do NOT work if you want 4K and HDR.

It’s an HDMI cable. 4K. The product is well-built, well-made, and is not expensive. After buying a few Amazon basics for office and computers and monitors I have come to search for Amazon basics first because The Amazon basics products are so well-made.

As several other reviewers have pointed out, these cables don't work with with the fourth generation Apple TV via a receiver and 4k TV with Dolby Vision/HDR (LG OLED).  The sound is fine and they work well in other applications. However, after a few minutes of viewing, the picture usually would start to flash with a large block of white  pixels running across the bottom of the screen. We spent weeks of trying to solve the issue with tech support and various update and configuration changes, only to find that installing a Belkin cable solved the problem immediately.

These cables (3-foot) work great for connecting HDMI devices that are in close range. Perfect for connecting my soundbar to my TV (both are wall mounted).I also own a couple of the 6-foot variants of this cable, and they are great as well. These cables (both the 3-foot and 6-foot) are able to handle 4K HDR no problem.

those cables would not allow the XBOX to work in 4K. I had a similar issue with my Roku Ultra which would not work with the 4K 60fps setting. I decided to try these as they are rated at 18Gbps. While the first cable I tried worked flawlessly (no artifacts, flickering or other issues), the other two did not work as well. I tried Twisted Veins HDMI cables as well and had similar issues. I finally picked up Monoprice cables and haven't had any problems. Most people have good luck with these cables in shorter lengths (6ft or less), however at 10ft or longer I

Runs as smooth as any modern HDMI cable should. Worthless for PS4 pro or Xbox One. Does not fully support 4K 60fps HDR. Picture flickers and eventually dies.
