I connected my Play Station and my soundbar with them.  Picture quality is good. I bought them 2 years ago and never experienced any problems with connection.They just work. Considering  the price, it's all I need.
I made the mistake of not testing this cable right away.If I had another cable to compare it to, I would've realized right away it was faulty.

I have been using the cable for a few weeks. The problem came when an ear shattering sound was produced during use. I tried to use different ports and even switching out the computer. After changing the hdmi cable the problem went away. The sound that came while using the cable was terrible.

To start off, the cable works great. Got solid picture quality and was plenty long enough (25ft) but the cable is stupid thick. I have a shorter version of this cable and it’s much, much thinner. I expected the 25ft cable to be thicker but it is almost an inch thick. I had planned on tucking this cable away but since it’s so thick and stiff it’s hard to tuck it away or keep it from bundling back up.Tl;dr - Great cable if you don’t mind it being super thicc

I was sorely disappointed in these HDMI cables as they were very poor quality.  I was truly hoping that by saving a few bucks it would be worth it, but I was wrong.  They did not work correctly, so therefore we had to return the cables and order different ones.  I did give 2 stars and not 1 star because the refund was issued right away and with no problems.

Why spend 2-3x the price for something that's just as good quality for way cheaper?! I don't believe in name brand HDMI cables as I don't need fancy colors, gold plated coverings, and brand names on my cable that will be tucked behind the wall or TV. Don't waste your money and just buy this one! Works great and haven't had any problems with it.

It should have been the perfect solution, but unfortunately as soon as I installed this cable to connect an HP 2311x monitor to my Apple MacBook Pro Retina I had nothing but problems. Complete computer slow downs. As in type in a letter and wait three seconds for it to appear, basically rending the computer useless to use. As soon as I unplugged the cable the problems went away. I don't know if it's the particular configuration of monitor/laptop or just a bad cable. I had to go back to the firewire connector/port which I was trying to free up for an external hard drive.

It worked just fine and the package was alright. I had no issues but I wouldn't recommend buying from Amazon basic for some of their tech products. The cord is like pre-bent into a circle to fix in a box. The cord is reliable just not easy to store because the material to shield the cord is stiff.

While the cord is good when it works, it often just doesn’t work and my tv says there is no video signal. I tried two different computers both had the same issues. So finally i tried a different hdmi cord and two days later still haven’t had an issue. Admittedly it works, but the video feed stops randomly (probably 3-6 times a day) and seems to stop working for as long as it wants to. I wouldn’t buy again.

Used in home studio for a mirrored monitor in a MacBook Pro system. Runs connected to an adapter and the signal is strong and high quality at the external monitor. Pleased with this as I could bury it in the walls and behind foam sound absorbing padding in the recording booth.  25 feet is plenty of distance to accomplish the vertical and horizontal distances from computer to booth.

These amazon basics hdmi cables are great. Even my long cables experience no issues with latency. The materials make these cables solid and durable. I have had mine running under a carpet with constant jumping on them from my kids and they have held up. They seem less expensive than what you buy at the big box stores and a fraction of the price

I've been using this cable for about 6 months. I noticed immediately that every so often I would lose HDMI signal but it happened so intermittently that I could ignore it. A dip once or twice a day wasn't a big deal to me. Now it happens every 5 minutes and is accompanied by flashes of static and 5 seconds of black. I wasn't sure if it was the cable or my monitor, so I switched to my display port and suddenly no more issues. You might get lucky and get a functioning cable that lasts more than 6 months, but mine is garbage.

I have purchased two of these cables and both have been fantastic. The first I use for my ps4 slim and the other for a BlueRay player. The cables themselves are great quality. I don't foresee them breaking or falling apart because they are just sitting there (I don't change cables very often). I would definitely recommend this cable to anyone that needs an HDMI Cable. The price was also very fair and always they arrived quickly with amazon prime.

I'm not kidding when I say that there is a $12,000 KDMI cable out-there. Funny thing is this works just as well (HDMI uses fiberoptics ie light). There no reason to have an HDMI cable with gold-plated connections, it does nothing for the quality of the video. Get this, you'll save yourself $11,993.00.

Great 4k compatible cable. Don't waste your time with other HDMI cables, this one probably does what you need and more. I didn't even know HDMI cables could have Ethernet. Very good quality as well.Very satisfied with my purchase, I'm finally getting to use my TV's 4k screen for once.

It still baffles me why people go into stores and pay 30% - 50% more on a simple HDMI cable. Not only does the AmazonBasics HDMI cable do everything its supposed to, it is also built very well. I have bought many HDMI cables that feel cumbersome and are difficult to fit behind monitors or TVs. Not the case with this cable. The connector is small enough so that it does not block other ports. The cable itself is manageable so you don't have a huge roll of extra cable dangling from behind your display as well. I'm happy with my purchase and I will definitely buy again when I have to upgrade my hardware.

After reading all these positive and negative reviews, I've decided to buy this. It's working out fine and no problem so far. I needed something with the length that's enough from my LED TV on top of my credenza style TV stand to my Sony Blu-ray below. I could go to nearest electronics store but it would cost me more but with less quality than this. I'd recommend this definitely.

Like they said, it's a basic 10' cable. It basically connects my cable box to my TV from any distance within 10'.That being said, my previous HDMI cable was cutting out a ton and this solved it, cheaply.

No need to purchase high end expensive HDMI cables UNLESS you were going in the wall with cables for mounting a TV or something. HDMI is a digital signal so it does not matter much only for longevity if you were going to mount tv, as higher end hdmi cables are made with premium quality on the outside. For everyone else amazon hdmi cables are more than ok

Worked as well as the 15+ dollar caves for way less money, if I need more cables in future( with puppies thinking they are chew toys it will happen sooner or later) I'm buying these again. I got these to connect TV to cable box, the original one the pups broke the end off in the TV port. Works like a charm.

Received on time in perfect condition and it works just as I needed to hook up my new laptop to my monitor.  I did need the dvi-d adapter as the monitor is a bit older but it works just fine. The HDMI to adapter connection and HDMI to laptop port is snug, smooth and not a struggle to put in like some cheap cables. In addition, my laptop will hook up directly to my newer projector without the adapter so fewer parts to get lost or be forgotten on the road.  The 6 foot length is perfect to allow a bit of slack in the hookup.  Too tight and the ends seem to find a way to get loose.

HDMI cables are pretty simple for most people's needs -- plug in each end and get your video/audio signal.  These fit the bill 100%.  I used these to do a full upgrade of the cables on my PC setup and I've notice zero signal degradation.  The cable is nice and flexible, making it easy to work and route as needed.  The plugs themselves are on the smaller side, which is a big benefit in my personal setup.  Will gladly buy again.

Theyre cheap enough to buy in bulk, work as described and get the job done; why go to the local department store and spend $20 on a single generic 6 foot cable when you can buy Amazon basic cables for $8~ for a pack of two?Amazon basic HDMI cables are priced almost disposably, I've never had one go bad or have a bad connection, but at the price they're offered, you could buy 4 or 5 of them, use one till it breaks and throw it away, then break out a new one and still save money on local department store prices.

As some others have pointed out, HDMI is a digital standard which means your HDMI cables just transmit data - 1's and 0's. There is no 'high fidelity' version or any qualitative difference like there was with cables back in the analog days. They either work or they don't. So if you've just spent $800 for a new surround receiver or large screen TV, just get as many of these as you need in the length you need. Even if you've got a couple of old HMDI cables that you 'think are good', just consider replacing them so you're sure you have the latest standard. For $6 or less is not even worth trying to figure out what those old cables are.

I bought this HDMI cable for my projector after the previous ones stopped working suddenly. This Cable is really good and works perfectly in every angle with multiple laptops. This is HDMI to HDMI cable and I use to connect from laptop's HDMI port to the projector's HDMI cable. The picture quality and audio quality are also really good and the 6 feet length is also really good. Not too much and not too little for a simple 2BHK apartment. Best quality product in this price range

I wont even go to the local store to buy an HDMI if I need it. You cant beat Amazon's value. I know they say that the other cords add better quality, but I havent experienced that yet. I have a 75" TV that is high quality and the Amazon HDMI works great. I also bought this for my mom who I bought the Fire TV for and there are NO issues!

My old one supplied by cable company was causing picture issues and they suggested a new HDMI cable.  It worked!!  All the weird issues with my TV have disappeared.  It had been constantly losing the cable connection and the TV picture shrunk to 1/4 of the screen and turned pink!!  All because of a old and bad HDMI cable.  Who knew!!

The HDMI 2.0b standard is about twice the bandwidth of HDMI 2.0a/1.4.  I have had a fairly hard time finding truly compliant cables.  The last ones I purchased almost worked (some did with HDCP off, a deal breaker).  If you have an  AppleTV 4K, Roku 4K, X-Box 1s/x these cables will work!  I checked them at full bandwidth with a signal generator (4K, YUV4:4:4, 60Hz, HDR8) both in a color bar/gray scale situation and a black screen looking for sparkles.  The cables passed with flying colors!  I also tested the 3 foot version with the same results.  So 6ft and 3ft are definitely compliant.  I did not purchase any other size.  Hope this helps!!!

I bought these to clean up my wiring. I had to install an HDMI plate and there are three of these, between the one in the wall, between the plates, and from each plate to a cable box and tv.I don't see any shakiness, grain, or any other issues when I watch high-def channels.

Be careful when installing. There is an input and output on this cable and it will NOT work if you hook it up backwards. Dont learn the hard way like me!!! Over all a decent cable. Not great quality but it works nice with no noticeable picture degradation. For the price it's worth a buy.

Great for hooking up a laptop from your couch to your TV. The length of the cable allows me to run it along the wall out and hiding it from plain view. The build quality is excellent albeit pretty thick but that may have to do with ensuring that quality isn't lost traveling 25 feet.

I know nothing about electronics but these get the job done. Tech people tell me there is no reason to splurge on a fancy HDMI cable, so I am glad that I ignored the Best Buy salesperson trying to push a $40 cable on me. The 3 feet one is shorter than I realized. I know, 3 feet, but it barely works for my setup and doesn't have far to go. I say get 6 feet if you have any concerns about length.
Amazon basics never lets me down! Just a very simple HDMI cable, just as described. Works as expected, no issues.

I got the recommendation to buy this amazon basic HDMI cable from my friend and it has been a good deal so far. After using the product for a couple of weeks I am facing no issues. The size of the cable is optimum for my use. A must product to work on monitors from home.

I use a (3 foot ) cable to connect a Samsung UHD TV to an Apple TV 4K - I had trouble with 2 other brands that claim to work  with chroma 4:4:4, HDR10, ARC, HDCP2, etc. but they had trouble holding 4:4:4. I returned them and thought I'd try this cable and it works perfectly.

I can't count how many times I've bought Amazonbasics cables. Ever since I discovered them, if I get an HDMI device, I buy these cables because they feel and seem to be high quality and not a generic piece of crap. I tell friends and family to buy them if they need a replacement and I give them away with my devices when I upgrade devices. I did not receive them for free and I'm not being paid for this review, although I do like the sound of free. Lol

This is a large commercial grade HEAVY THICK cable! - almost 1/4” thick.  It seems more appropriate at a rock concert.  The long length means it can be used for presentations.  It certainly does the job and at a great price too.  (Cheaper than Monoprice.) will buy again.
All lengths of this HDMI high speed cable are compatible with HDMI 2.0 and earlier specifications.PROS:

I am very pleased with this item....the durability, resolution to tv, etc. Had to replace a HDMI cable because the one I had failed! 🤔, It was sitting in storage for 2 years. I read one that this cable was sooo heavy that someone was "concerned" that it would damage their connector end on tv .... Really? Rubbish!)You won't be disappointed if you get this cable. Going to order another length.

I love the image quality with this cable and it's so strong and durable!  Not your average wimpy HDMI cable!  Highly recommend this and I love the 15 foot length as it allows us to hook up the laptop to the TV and not be right next to it!  LOVE IT!
I have had mine in use for 1 years.  I'm now saving some oxidation issues and I have had to plug and unplug the cable several times to clear the oxidation otherwise, get a error message from my roku.

Switched to an old 3' Amazon basic cable I had laying around and it worked fine. Not sure if it's a problem with the 10' version or what, but I'm a bit disappointed.
What?! You don't have to pay an arm and a leg for a nice cable? Those long winded reviews for the more expensive cables are a waste of effort. Get these.

This thing is thick and huge. So the pictures do not do it any justice.  This thing is huge in diameter, thick and stiff.  It’s defiantly a very heavy duty cord.  Can be a bit too heavy duty for my purpose but it does it’s job. Pleased with purchase.

After doing some research on 4k HDMI cords I found out that regular cord process the same speed that ones that say they are 4k cords. So I purchased these and my 4k tv, Blu-ray, and home receiver output a great picture and Netflix, amazon, Disney plus, all have great pictures and sound.

I've bought varying lengths of this product from Amazon several times now and I've never had any issues. It's an HDMI cable, there isn't much else to it.One downside is it doesn't make my roomate's terrible taste in music any better. Ah well.

For the first time ever, We ceiling mounted our projector and needed a long HDMI cable. This was perfect. Up through the wall, into the ceiling and out over the projector. 2 hour install. Perfect Cable with no lag.Buy it!

25’ works with some devices and adapters, but not with others. It probably needs to be a thicker gauge to expand its compatibility. Works, comes in different lengths and strengths. I have a heavy duty one that is 20' for the purpose it has to go 20' from a to b. And I have a couple for other small TVs that I use (have to) the top level "Roku" box. Tv to Roku box with the HDMI. My HD is crisp and clear! This sell has the best service and price.

This is for the 25 Feet version, it's too rigid to route through tight corners, and it is coiled so even if you stretch it, it doesn't stay flat, the material is just too thick. I wish I knew about this before buying it because it's gauge is nothing like the standard HDMI cable. Looks like industrial pipe running around my desk at the office and at home to my consoles.

If you need a relatively short HDMI wire with decent picture quality, look no further. Used to run my laptop to my PC for watching videos, I experience no lag or quality issues with either the video or audio feed that runs over this wire.

I have 2 monitor which I use to connect for my work. I was looking for HDMI cable to extend my display to monitor. I have ordered amazon HDMI cable. I am using it with the Nintendo Switch at the moment and unfortunately the back doesn’t close because of the thickness, minor inconvenience that the back has to stay open.
HDMI cable stopped working - does not establish connection from computer to monitor - after only 4 months of light use.

These cables are almost twice as thick as any other HDMI cable, including Amazon’s own “Basics” cable from last year. If you run these through an in-wall cable-hide be aware. It may not fit.Returned immediately after opening the box. Sad face

Unfortunately, I got unlucky with this 25ft cable. Can't hold a 4k 60z signal. Keeps blinking in and out when I hook up my PC to my UHDTV. It seems to work fine with any signal other than that though, so if you are in the market for a long 1080p cable (maybe even 4k 30hz?), this will do fine.Why do I know it's the cable? I tested my system with a shorter high speed hdmi cable I have, and my signal was perfect, even after hours of use. Of course, that meant I had to temporarily move my PC next to my TV to test, which is not a set up I want to keep, otherwise I wouldn't have bothered with a long cable such as this.

This product is heavy duty and appears to be well made, however it will NOT transmit a Dolby Vision or HDR signal without constant flickering from any source.  I purhased a 15 foot Fuzion HDMI cable and it worked perfectly...although it is much more expensive  ~6X.
A cable is a cable. It works. Though I’m replacing it with a hdmi 2.0 cable now that I have a 4k monitor.

Bought a 2 pack of 3 ft cables so we could have a spare. Had a longer cable from Wal-Mart when we bought the TV about 3 years and suspected that it was going bad due to bad picture or no picture. Works well, occasional black screen on both laptop and monitor when pausing/playing videos that lasts a couple seconds.
Cable is not capable of transmitting a 4K60 signal with HDR10 enabled. Tested on multiple displays using windows PC, PS4 Pro and XBOX.Cable displays fine at 1080p HDR10.

Used this to hook up my Roku to tv.  Worked fine for 1 day but on 2nd day picture kept coming and going, then finally no picture at all.  Checked everything else and all was fine, so had to be the cable.  Have ordered another brand to try.  I know some people said they had the same type of problem and reordered another cable, but I decided to try another brand.

Was told these cables helped make you PC run HDR at 60hz. They do not, but they are really cheap and they work as good as any expensive cables. I would buy them again, if I didn't already have 20 pair of various brands that all work just as good.

guys, so this wire is pretty thick.  i ran i for my dvr monitor (home security system). at first nothing came out. so i was in the process of returning it. i then saw a little tv icon on wire tip. i flipped it around and shazzam, it works. so, make sure you look at the wire tips and run it the right way.

Always buy Amazon Basics HDMI cables for whatever lengths I need for all electronics. Always perform as good as much more expensive brands. Have never failed me or family members I have given them to. A great dependable product. Bought this 15 footer when I moved my bluray player and 9 footer wasn't long enough to hide in running from HDTV.

DO NOT BUY THIS CABLE!!!! I have never had an HDMI cable go bad before but this one did. Less then 2 years old and now I have to take it out of my wall and snake another cable in the wall. Items arrived in a timely manner and do exactly as expected. I am currently using one to connect my laptop to a monitor for use as an extra screen for work. I have also hooked it up to my laptop to watch movies.10/10 would recommend.

Yes, I still believe you can install a second display on an iMac. These didn't work so went with high priced option. And, they didn't work either! I was lucky to come across this great deal (go with the two pack! There is barely a price difference)!  Glad I just happened to come across these so quick & easy with such helpful reviews, I did not think twice to try them & they work amazing! No difference in pic btw the orginal cables vs thess. These cables are terrific, and before ordering for our HDMI switcher, I did some research on the best HDMI cables and these came in the top 5 on 5 different sites. Amazing cables!  I replaced all of my HDMI cables with the AmazonBasics cables.  They improved the clarity of each TV's display.  All of my TVs are flat screen and 1080p. With all of the expensive HDMI cables on the market, it will be hard for other manufacturers to beat Amazon.  Their price point on this item is unbelievable!  And, they support 4k, as well.

These little HDMI cords are great. I really just need a short HDMI cord for all of my cables going into my many switches and these do the trick. I cant comment on how good their performance is, I am using them to run a monitor at 4k though, frame rate is 30 hz. One of the things I like most about them is that the HDMI connector itself does not have a huge rubberized shroud around it, making it much easier to connect multiple cables next to each other and keep cable management easy.

Two for the price of one is an amazing deal! The material is great and it displays a great picture. I’d recommend this over and over again and I plan on buying again when I need another hdmi cable.

I call this my nasa cord. Very thick, 25 feet long.  Amazon made one quality fine product, probably the best purchase I have ever made, other than the depends for my grandma. Changing her is bad which gave this cord the edge in best purchase ever.Would buy again.

Awful cables. Amazon selling them with a description that says they support HDR with 18Gbs bandwidth is just false advertising. The cable worked great and I can't tell the difference in image quality between the cable and others I've paid more for.

I bought this to plug into my TV and have available for the occasional use of my computer onto the big screen. It works beautifully and was priced reasonably. If I need another or similar, I would consider this brand first in the future.

So glad Amazon recommended this cable when purchasing the Fire Cube.  My husband was reading the installation instructions for the Cube and complaining about needing to go buy a cable when he realized that I had purchased one along with the cube.  End of complaining.  Hooked up nicely.

They’re a cable that works well.

This sturdy,  well made, 6' black HDMI to HDMI cable will be used to connect an HDMI outlet in a C Port maxi hub for a new Mac Air to a monitor instead of using a VGA converter cable which is seen by some as outdated. This cable was at a cost effective price.

I purchased the 25 ft cable to play my video games in either one room or another, using wireless controllers and an HDMI switch box.  Even with the unpowered switch box, I did not experience any noticeable lag or loss of quality in picture and sound.  Would recommend for any other long distance wiring venture

I bought the 3ft short cables for a gaming PC. Windows works great, but full-screen mode with these cables and that PC (Ryzen 5 2400G) would cause the screen to black-out at any screen refresh frequency higher than 50Hz. Using a different, longer cable resolved the issue.

I bought this HDMI cable to go with a switch box so I could easily switch between a DVD player, game console, and my Fire Stick. It passes signals clearly, and is long enough for me to easily position the switch box where I needed it. For the money it is an excellent buy.

This cable is great. It is super thick and sends the signal well. I had trouble when I purchased a longer cable from a different manufacturer. My setup consists of sending the signal from a receiver, via HDMI, to a HDMI to VGA converter, which then plugs into an analog projector. The receiver has to detect that something is plugged into the HDMI cable before it will output any signal. The other cable was not sending the return signal for whatever reason, so I purchased this one and have not had any problems.

They are lighter weight than the "fancy" HDMI cables and have absolutely no problems with signal (audio or video). Since they're short and flexible compared to pretty much every other HDMI cable out there, the clutter behind my components has vastly improved. Now my entertainment center looks half presentable without a next of wires hanging below all of the components.These are perfect for running short connections between stacked components and (in my case) a stereo receiver.
These HDMI cables from Amazon are at a great price point and works effectively to hook up any AV units together.

I'm not sure about the quality of every cable sold but mine work fine. Good picture/sound quality and no issues to speak of solid build too. I say buy as many as you can at once so you don't have to keep ordering when you need more cables

I don't believe that there is a ton of difference in HDMI cables, except perhaps in durability.  I needed to connect my laptop to my TV to stream programs that all of a sudden have proliferated.  This cable did the trick, with no fuss.  Recommended.

The picture quality and overall quality of the cable was fine. Once it stopped working though, I contacted Amazon for a replacement since they advertised it as having a lifetime warranty. Instead, they told me to re-order the cable instead of sending me a replacement. Despite asking them about the warranty, I was given the same answer to re-order it myself.

I have been using this cable to connect my computer to my TV to use as a monitor. This long cable reaches halfway across the room, allowing me to sit back and use my PC in comfort without having to get up to access the tower. This cable provides adept refresh rates suitable for all but hardcore gamers (being limited as it is HDMI and not DisplayPort). The cable is very sturdily built and sits nicely in the ports of both my TV and computer, and does not disconnect even when shifting my entire tower.

Inexpensive, this was purchased to route through a wall from a TV to the Blu-Ray player and a Wii game console (with an HDMI adapter) so the wires are not seen dropping down from the TV.  (Especially easy as the wall behind is an unfinished storage room)  Naturally we needed longer cables, and this did the trick with little extra loose cable to hide.  Have NOT tried to use these though for 4K signal, the TV already has a Roku 4 built in.  Picture from a good Blu-Ray player looks awesome though!

As long as you're not looking for 8K, these are perfect.  Don't waste money on "brand name" cables. They do the exact same thing. I actually know what I'm talking about as I've been in TV post production for more than 40 years.

My CIO once told me that one of the biggest wastes of money was to buy high end HDMI cable. Digital signals are a string of 1s and 0s. They are either received or they are not. They are either received or they are not. So unlike analog signals there is no issue with line noise. These cables get the job done at a fraction of what you’d pay for Monster cables.

Everything works great. Don't listen to the reviews that said Dolby Vision doesn't work on the Apple TV. They probably didn't set up their AV receiver and TV settings properly. The TV and the AV receiver has a setting that is listed as HDMI Deep Color or HDMI Enhanced that you will need to enable for HDR and Dolby Vision. Also it is preferred to set up the match settings under the video settings for the Apple TV.

Exactly what you would expect for the price. Works just fine. I throw mine around a lot, and works fine. Only thing I would add is it come very round up, and stay curved for a while if you don’t stretch it out to start. If I needed another I would get this again

I bought this because I needed to connect a Roku Premiere Plus to my Yamaha RX-A750 receiver, which feeds my Vizio P55c1 monitor. My old HDMI cable wouldn’t support 4K + HDR. This cable does the job. For those who are saying that this cable won’t support HDR, check the settings for each component in your display chain. I had to enable HDR on the Roku, receiver and monitor separately. HDR won’t work unless every component in the chain supports HDR and is correctly configured for it.

A little over 15 for a 25 feet cord... I can't tell you how that seems so foreign to big retail companies like Walmart and Best buy. I didn't even need 25 feet, I needed about 10, but I got this anyways because you never know. So I really got more than I bargained for. Please... Do yourself a favor, an HDMI cable is no more special than those fancy $30 5 feet HDMI cord (I don't think they do anything imo).Just amazing for the price and quality!

No HDR support. I'm not sure to believe some reviews on here claiming HDR worked for them. When I connected my PS4 pro to my brand new HDR 4K TV the screen goes black. I tried an old HDMI cable I had and it worked just not this new amazonbasics HDMI cable. Sucks!

I use this for a pretty niche application which is connecting all my old school video games with av into an av consolidator and then I have a av to hdmi adaptor which I use this cable for. Overall it works amazing on my new 4K tv and I can play all my old school games with no worries. If it can handle this it’ll handle just about anything.

Great hdmi! I ordered 25ft and split my receiver to my beedroom.  Solid cord the cord is thicker than anticipated but worth it.  I'm confident to fish this cord since it is thicker and very durable.  I shouldn't need a replacement anytime soon.
Pass through hdmi 2.0a with hdcp 2.2 with no problems.  I use it for samsung uhd blu ray connected to my LG OLED 65ef9500 and the HDR signal passes through.

I bought this with the idea of hooking my computer to my TV (Both in separate rooms) so I could play games in my living room on my couch. Worked like a charm! I experienced no regression in either sound or picture quality and the cable is very heavy duty so I was able to run in under my carpet without the worry that it would get worn down. Fantastic high quality cable for sure.

I purchased a new 65inch LG 4K TV for the intended purpose of using it as a computer monitor.  It was a very shaky start.  I started with a media bridge branded cable, as well as another dressed up import cable.  NEITHER of the two worked in 4:4:4 Chroma, or High Range color, as LG described it.  I was crushed.  I ordered this 2 pack of 10 ft Amazon Basics cables, and one worked perfectly with my PC, in 4K 60hz and 4:4:4 chroma.  The other cables were dispatched for use with my 1080p bluray player.  I just received a 4K bluray player for my birthday, and I hooked it up to my TV with one of the 'fancy' cables to HDMI 3 on my TV.  Colors seemed a bit flat (Magnificent 7).  After watching the movie, I got to reading my manual again.  I realized I had it hooked up through a port which did not support the High Range color.  My PC was on port 2, and I had mistaken port 3 for port 1.  I swapped the fancy cable to port 1, and it would NOT sync video.  Despite claims of being HDMI 2.0.  I pulled the 2nd Amazon Basics cable fromt he box, and hooked it up between my 4K player and Port 1, and it worked instantly.  Now I'm miffed at being lured into 'fancy' cables.  I recommend these cables to ANYONE.  Although, there is talk of HDMI2.2, and expanded MDCP protections.. These worked on my 4K player, and the colors were much deeper. Buy these!  I buying another 2 pack as spares.  Thank you Amazon!
I mean it worked but broke really fast still have the other one but don't know how long that will last!

I bought this switch to switch between a game machine and a satellite receiver to a single TV monitor. The switch appears well made, however, when I select the satellite receiver the sound cycles on and off unless I disconnect the cable to the game controller, which pretty much defeats the purpose of having to deal with cables when I want to use another device. Can't recommend this product for that reason.

Cables work well running a PC in 1440.  Unfortunately when streaming Xfinity TV to my PC, the video flickers like crazy.  I have to bring my monitor resolution down to 1080 and TV streams fine.  It is an annoyance that I decided to live with.

Cheaper grade cable, no issues with that. However the main issue is the picture cuts in and out sometimes very often (2-5 times an hour or so).  Using this cable from my 4K fire HD to my TV (Samsung sUHD). I’m not sure if the cable speed is poor or the cable connections are damaged but it’s befuddled me. I’ve tried to unplug, clean out the terminals then plug back in but no success.Definitely will be sticking to a higher end cable from now on.

however after purchasing a XBOX One X, those cables would not allow the XBOX to work in 4K. I had a similar issue with my Roku Ultra which would not work with the 4K 60fps setting. I decided to try these as they are rated at 18Gbps. While the first cable I tried worked flawlessly (no artifacts, flickering or other issues), the other two did not work as well. I tried Twisted Veins HDMI cables as well and had similar issues. I finally picked up Monoprice cables and haven't had any problems. Most people have good luck with these cables in shorter lengths (6ft or less)

Like everyone else on here has been saying, you don't need crazy expensive cables.  You just have to meet the requirements.  Just purchased the 4k LG Oled with a yamaha 4k receiver and am using this for 4K/HDR 60FPS with no issues whatsoever.  These are the only cables you need and that's coming from an ex-Magnolia salesman!

I had a problem with strange, random audio dropouts when using this HDMI with a Cisco CHS 435DHS Set Top Box / DVR (used with Verizon FIOS cable service) and an LG  Oled65b7a  65" OLED TV.  After a long investigation, the problem was fixed by replacing this cable with an HDMI cable provided by Verizon. It took several service calls and a Verizon $99 charge because the fault was in my cable. I've used Amazon basic cable in other places with good results but not with this equipment.

Required purchase to accomplish VGA to HDMI conversion. Looks good on 1920 horizontal. I haven't any critical tests for resolution but the display is 38.5" diagonal, only 720p horizontal so the 1920 is redundant and undetectable. Sorry.
We plugged it into the tv and it instantly snapped. I have never seen an HDMI do that before.

The cables that state they are gold plated and all that other stuff are hot air trying to get you to pay more for nothing. These cables are just as good and reasonably priced. Only thing you might want to watch is the length because these are shorter but I measured first to make sure this is what would work.
way cheaper than going to Best Buy or should I say Best rip off when it comes to cables among other things.

I needed a cable that would run across the room on occasion and easy to curl up and store when not in use.  Tried a different brand first and it was too stiff. This one is perfect, have now used it many times with no issues.

Thankfully, my new HP computer has an HDMI port so that I can connect my older HP monitor.  These HDMI cables are perfect!  The price beats other cables out there.  I will buy more when the need arises.  Thanks Amazon!

These HDMI cables were perfect for what my wife and I needed, after we purchased an HDMI switch for our multiple devices (Apple TV, cable box, Blu ray player, etc.). The reason why I say cables (plural form) is because I ended up buying a second cable, as the first one was nice and durable. If I need a third, fourth, etc. I will most definitely purchase this same cable again.

not worth it, i bought this so i can connect my laptop to my tv on my bed.  the picture quality is average and the sound keeps going on and off so because of that i can't really watch tv on my bed.  save yourself the money.

Every time we move, we mount our TVs and leave our HDMI cables in the wall and thus need new ones. We always buy these because of how inexpensive they are and how quickly they come in with Amazon Prime. They’ve never failed us! We like that they come in many sizes and have the gold plating. No need to buy anything more expensive, these will do the job great!

Excellent product. I was having issues with the "handshake" between my TV, Sound Bar, A/V receiver.  My thought process was that my old HDMI cords just were't up to date; with my newer TV/Soundbars.  I was correct. These new cords fixed the audio issues I was running into

Nothing negative to say. The item works exactly as expected. One of the things I did like, is that it’s not so tightly wrapped that the cord is overly bent in the curves. It straightened out pretty well right out of the box.

Not sure what else I could possibly add about these cables that has not already been said. They are as advertised and work as they should. Seem to be high quality and I would recommend them to someone looking to buy some 4K/high speed HDMI cables.

The exFat file system is a Microsoft proprietary system. If you are using Windows, fine. However, if you are using Linux you will need to install some software: exfat-fuse and exfat-utils. Android may or may not be able to read this file system (probably not) without installing additional software as well. Just be aware.

It's an HDMI cable - what else is there to say? It works and I haven't had any trouble with it. This cable is quite thick, so keep that in mind if you're planning on running this along a wall. You would likely need some pretty large clips/staples to be able to fit this thing. At this price, a 25-foot cable is a steal. This is my second AmazonBasics cable, and both have worked quite well, and the value can't be beat.For those looking for a cheap but quality HDMI cable, this is the best thing I've come across so far.

Truly amazing what this cable has done for us. We used to just watch on our computers 11 inch screen. Then we head about an HDMI cable and it has taken our viewing to a while new level. The ability to connect the computer with a projector or even a thing leaves endless possibilities! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a boost in viewing power.

Get what you pay for here, but seems to be very fragile. If you baby it, you may get more time out of the cable. I got a higher quality one and have been good for over a year, so these might get expensive if buying a lot.

These cables are excellent HDMI cables. They arrive promptly and work perfectly. I ordered these to use to connect a PS4 and a computer to my TV. The pictures are clear and precise, and there's virtually no detectable lag (which I've experienced with cheaper varieties of these cords). The cord length allows for great flexibility in the arrangement of my setup, too. I highly recommend these cords to anyone looking for them. There's no need to spend $20+ on one "deluxe" or "high quality" cable when this option is equally good and only $9 for two.

After years of overpaying for single HDMI cables at the local big box, I found these are truly the best buy! For much less than their 'lowest priced' quality brand, I was able to get 3 cables. They construction quality is good. And they deliver 4K content from my Roku Premier +, Apple 4K and Fire TV Gen 2 to my 4K Samsung TV. I will never buy HDMI cables at a retail store again!

I've bought Amazon HDMI with ethernet cables before, and they were as thin as a normal HDMI cable. So why is this 15 foot one as thick as an ethernet cable? At 15 ft, it's even more important for it to be thin, because I'm obviously not running it from one thing in my entertainment center to another. It's highly visible and ugly.

I purchased a television and receiver. I  wanted to connect my XBOX, PlayStation, and Wii U to the receiver. Right now, I have one HDMI Cable and every time we use one of the game systems, we have connect and disconnect, such a hassle. I bought two of these cables and now all three game systems are connected. They work perfectly.

I actually have Amazon Basics HDMI cables all throughout my house. They are super cheap and work perfectly. Exactly as well as cables costing 5 times as much. It is strange that 2 is the same price as 1 but I wont complain about getting a free spare.

Work perfectly at top specs with LG OLED and Apple 4K TV.  Get Dolby Vision, 4K, 4:4:4 and whatever the top spec is for a signal type provided.  Good flexibility, reasonable size, and they just fade into the background (like I want my cable to do).  I now own 10 of these cables in different sizes for the same price as one cable from the Apple Store.

It's an HDMI cable. Works perfectly. Nothing fancy, but a great price as compared to some that cost $60 and beyond. I'd never pay that for a stupid cable, and that's why i bought this one and am not disappointed at all.

It's a 10 ft HDMI cable that delivers high quality picture and sound. I have not noticed any signal degradation, but I'm not a tech junkie audiophile either. I do love good quality sound and picture though and this delivers.

Does exactly what it's supposed to.  Like, I feel like it should do more for five stars but it's a cable.  If you expect it to sing and dance it's a let down, but if you're expecting what it says in the tin it's perfect.

That's one of the good things about the Amazon Basics stuff -- they work.  You don't need to spend tons on an HDMI cable.  This one does exactly what it's supposed to do.  I've seen no problems with the signal or the picture; they're clear and strong.

I tried everything to fix my flickering AppleTv3: factory reset, changing from 1080p to 780p, restarting and waiting a few minutes, even getting a newer AppleTv4. Turns out, all I needed was a new HDMI cord, which was a surprise because the one I was using was a high quality monster cord.
First one would disconnect after a few minutes. Second one seems to work fine.

I know the reviews on here are great but the cable I ordered was not picked up by my tv or receiver and just didn't work. I immediately swapped it out with another cheapo hdmi cable it the signal/picture came right through.  Possibly defective cable but that was my experience.

This cable is very good for the price.  As long as all of the ones and zeroes come through quality of the video and audio will be just as good as any other cable.  They all appear to make it through this cable.  I would definitely recommend.

I like this Amazon Basics High-Speed HDMI Cable - 6 Feet (Latest Standard) well enough.  I don't see any problems with my LED Samsung and my AV Yamaha receiver during movies and my daily news is not adversely affected by it's use.  Whether it is up to the "Latest Standards", ? Well I'll just have to let the tight panted bearded geeks out there, determine that !  It works for me.

Bought this when my old HDMI cable stopped working and now use it on a 4K TV. Works great and supports HDR on PlayStation 4 which is a great added bonus. Don't waste money on "premium" HDMI cables since they all do the same thing.

I got this for my laptop to connect with a 20 inch monitor. It can also connect to my flat screen television. It works well with no problems so far. Pictures and sounds are transmitted fast with good color quality.  I got it quickly in the mail and was able to start using it right out of the package.
Connects my laptop to monitors and tvs.  Get's the job done at a good price.

These are great cables.  Basics only though, no even fancy package - but a plain box, perfect. They feel sturdy and well built.  I do have to admit that I don't plug/unplug them often, if I did, I'd probably choose a braided type cable.  But I am using them to hook up stuff to my receiver so after they're in, they're not going anywhere.

I purchased this HDMI cable to use with my Apple TV, however, the picture quality was extremely pixelated.  I used another HDMI cable to troubleshoot the issue and it worked fine, so the one I received may have been defective.

An exceptional bargain is to be had with these cables.  I ordered the 2 pack and they work perfectly.  Actually their arrive date was 1 day after I had purchased a new TV and blu ray player and I was anxious to get everything hooked up.  With that thought in mind, I ran to Walmart and purchased 1 hdmi cable for literally twice the amount of the 2 pack from Amazon.  I still needed 1 more cable so did use one from my Amazon order and it's always good to have a spare around.  I would not hesitate to recommend these at all.  Thank you Amazon!

My husband ordered this High -Speed HDICable for faster internet speed for computers and television. He got this very reasonable. This item was great in making the connections right.  An excellent price for an item that was very necessary  The part rates a five star.

Great HDMI cables for $6.99. You don't need those "monster cables" costing much more. Cables are cables. These are gold-tipped and work just as well as those "premium" cables that are a scam and a waste of money. Believe me, save your money for something worthwhile by buying these for under $7.

Definitely recommended for setting up multiple components at once. Like when you've just moved and when you finally find the box the cables were in, your husband can't remember which color twist tie meant working and which color meant not working or how many of each there were supposed to be.

It works perfectly in my case.  With this cable and a 4k 60hz "Plugable" pigtail adapter, I got excellent results connecting MBP to my 4k TV.  The pictures and videos I shot from Canon FF camera had shown fine details that I could not see before from MBP 13" retina display screen.  Very happy with it.

Don't spend or shop any more for an HDMI cable. This will do everything you need and support the highest end protocols/connections you might ever need. Well reviewed along with a similar cable from monoprice- get either and stop thinking about it.

So far, I’m very happy I ordered this. After going wireless with my phone, I started wanting all my devices to be wireless. I started with my Kindle PW, using this charger. Works well, and fits in the case without much of a bulge. The only thing is that it seems a little harder to center on the charger than my phone, but it’s not a big deal.

This cable seems fine after I used it for a couple of months. But then I notice that occasionally the TV turns off and on again. It hasn't happened frequently but greatly reduces my experience. When I switch to use it to connect my computer monitor, the problem happens even more often and it drives me nut.After that, I buy another HDMI cable and it doesn't have the same problem that the Amazon HDMI cable has. This concludes that the Amazon HDMI cable I got is not reliable. Be aware about that possibility.

We've been using this for months, to connect a computer to a tv across the room.  This bypasses wifi, so there's no delay.  It allows us to play games, watch streaming video or dvds, etc. ... with fewer devices.

Thought we had an issue with our new smart TV but then realized it might be the older HDMI cord. Changed it out to the amazon cable and all was fixed. No other issues. Seems well made, especially for the price!

I reckon you get what you pay for.  Bought this early this year.  Left it plugged into the Samsung TV and, when needed, plugged it into the PC.  We did this perhaps five times.  Now it doesn't work.  It ain't me, babe.
WIll only honor 1 year warrnaty, then won't post reviews that warn others about this.

I can display (second screen) from my PC on my TV (40" or so), so we can play old console games with an emulator and a couple of xbox one controllers. Pulled it over door frames and such, and it sits pretty well. Nothing professional, so it's a quick and dirty solution. Works fine.

Ran this in my workshop, it enabled me to use an LED projector to make a 140" TV screen.  Would definitely buy again, because this one works when other cables did not, they could not handle the signal over 50 feet.

What the heck did I buy? I wanted a HDMI cable, not a garden hose. This thing is heavy duty as heck, but I gotta find something more slim and flexible. Remember the old coax cable, this is like those things. Beefy!

Seems very good quality and it works well, but the cable is super thick and heavy.  I bought this for travel/business presentations, but it's not very compact for that purpose.  I may look for a more compact cable.

I wondered how an HDMI cable could be that long and not have signal degradation. Well these cable are really thick and heavy duty and go up our wall, above the ceiling and then down to the ceiling mounted projector without any loss of quality.

I used the cable for travel.  The cable shows no wear but just quit working after plugging and unplugging cable about 10 times.  Might be a solid cable if you run it and never touch it again but for me it is trash!

I used this cable to put the Switch on a table behind the couch, connected to a wall mounted TV on the other side of the room. The length made it perfect for this use case, and being rated to go through walls helped keep the routing clean. My only gripe is the cable itself is THICK. It tucked under carpet easily, but having to make a sharp turn behind the TV did require an adapter.

My 10 year old HDMI cables wouldn't carry a 4K HDR 60 fps signal to my new TV and receiver. Got 2 cables for a great price and they work as advertised. I initially only got 30 fps but it turned out I needed to made a setting adjustment on my TV to accept 60 fps. Watched the latest episode of The Grand Tour (Columbia - Part 1) and it was amazing.

Don't fall victim to getting more length than you really need. The price barely changes the longer you go and It might seem like a great value. However, after a few months, all that extra cable laying on the floor will make your set-up look cluttered. I have a 55 inch 4k tv hanging on a glass tv stand with a player on the second of 3 shelves. 3 feet is more than enough length. Unless you have a huge tv, I strongly recommend trying out this shorter length first before going for that 6 foot option.

I recently purchased the latest Apple TV and wanted to take advantage of features I couldn't using an older HDMI cable I had. In particular, I was looking for a cable that supported ARC. In addition to allowing sound to travel bilaterally, it also allows for my Apple TV to turn on and off my tv. This is a plus as I don't need to search for multiple remotes. Best of all, there is no programming needed.

I use the cable to connect the television to the soundbar. Because the television gets its data either from an antenna or WiFi, I don't send picture information through the cable. I originally used fiber optics to make the sound connection, but the HDMI cable allows the use of ARC to turn the soundbar on and off with the television.

Bought three pack, all three did not work. Would not work with Xbox, Dolby vision, HDR, 4K, and would not work with Apple TV 4K HDR, and Dolby vision. Constantly got sparkles, dropped signals, screen flickering, extremely annoying.

I got the 25ft version. The cable is sturdy and good quality. I had no issues with it except it is unwieldy thick. It’s unusable if you have a tight corner. It reminds me of high wattage extension cords. Unfortunately it wasn’t in the description.

This cable has been perfect for my use. The measurements advertised are accurate. I am using it between my gaming computer and 4k tv. It handles it at 60Hz just fine. I was and still am really impressed with the build quality of this cable. I am used to dealing with HDMI cables, but this is by far the sturdiest I have come across. Don't expect to be able to turn this cable 180 degrees without a bit of space. The plug itself is very nice and heavy duty, more so than I am used to seeing. I will note that as a result of the build quality, this cable is larger in diameter than I am used to seeing. It is also a bit stiffer which is why I say that you will need a bit of space to make corners of 180 turns with it. I have it running around the periphery of my room so I don't have any issues in this regards, but if your entertainment center has some tight spots it could be problematic. If your tv has a jack coming straight out the back towards the wall instead of to the side, it could also be a problem depending on how close to the wall your tv is mounted. The signal quality seems good and I have never had issues with it in the 6 months I have owned it.This is definitely a 5-star product at a fantastic price point.

I can't help but laugh when people buy those fancy hdmi gold wired dual-braided steel fiber cables thinking they'll last forever.  If you are looking for something cheaper, effective, and long lasting then just buy this cable!  All the other stuff is a waste of your money!!!  Did you know that cables, such as this one, only cost $2 (at most) to produce?  All the other high priced stuff is just taking advantage of people who don't know better.

I use this to hook up my macbook to my TV. The connection is not tight and it drops off, not completely but enough to lose the picture and sound, and sometimes on reconnection it doesn't pick up the sound until you reset it a few times.

I have to say that the amazonbasics has been blowing away most of the competition out there. The price and quality for the price is decent. I have not had any problems with seeing any sparkles on my monitor and worked as promised! I have used this for over 1.5 years and still going strong!

As a former sales person of stereo equipment we were always told to "push new cables on new purchases", and for good reason. I think the markup on cables and such might surpass jewelry!! It's just horrible. So stop buying those overpriced cables and buy them here on Amazon, or at a couple of other online retailers, for much, MUCH less. They work just as well as the name brand cables, just without the fancy colors, or the fancy labels. But hey, if you've got one of those unlimited budgets and money is no objec

I inadvertently broke the existent HDMI cable while moving the TV to clean behind, and had to buy a new one, but little did I know that I actually needed a new one.  It’s amazing what a difference it made.
We use these frequently for computers, and they work great. Great price since we buy in bulk, so that helps us keep the cost down for our own installs.

I replaced a no-name brand that came with a TV I purchased that was a little too short. This cable works flawlessly!I've used some of the higher cost "premium" HDMI cables, and will never pay top dollar again. There is no noticeable difference from the picture quality, or the speed of the media that is being transmitted. Save yourself the extra $15 and just buy an Amazon Basics cable instead.

Excellent cables, good price point.  As many have said before, more expensive cables are not always better.  Don't buy into the marketing hype (I'm looking at you, Monster).  HDMI cables will either work or not work.  Unless you're running super-long lengths of cable, it doesn't really matter what you buy (as long as the specs match what you need, for example you need a high-speed cable for 4K, some will have integrated ethernet channel, some won't).  People who claim otherwise either don't know how to setup their devices to work with each other, or have defective cables.

This cable worked for like a week and I couldn’t be more disappointed. It just stopped working RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF WATCHING A NEW EPISODE OF GAME OF THRONES. I will be going to a different source to buy a replacement and returning this one tomorrow. 0/10 would not recommend.
Device came with short cable and needed longer cable to route cleanly.  Also used with right angle adapters.Picture quality appears to be fine.

I bought this?Okay - I know it’s very good as another has asked for one of the same.  These are much better than the one which is a long charger for my iPad, that charger slows charging down, I found it’s a common issue with the Apple king cord.

Very dependable cable at a good price. I like that I can order them and get them in a few days. I have used these cables for several years now and they are still working very well. I am very satisfied with these cables.

This is a thick cable because it's passive and not directional like the longer cables but it works just fine with the 1080p or 4k output of my Sony A7 cameras into an Elgato capture card to record my podcast.
Pros only• Excellent output quality

Maybe I got a bad cable. After installing and zipped tied, the cable failed to pass any signal. 35feet is a long run for HDMI but other brands of cable can handle it. Not worth the time to unzip tie and send back.

When I buy cables, I don't want to pay top dollar. BUT, it's a lot of work running and hiding cables -  they've got to be well built, so I don't need to replace them. These cables do well. Highly recommended

Was very happy because it's hard to compare via the telephone picture versus the actual item which I did have it was just a little shorter than what I had wanted but I was very happy quite content when I received it and it fit perfectly

I’m all for not spending a ton of miscellaneous cables/accessories. These fit the bill! We needed extra HDMI cables for our kids to use with 2nd monitors for virtual schooling and didn’t want to spend more than necessary. These are perfect.

I thought the cables were initially defective; my AppleTV 4K would flicker when even doing things like youtube (which is not 4k). It would work seamlessly for a while and then go in an endless flicker, I finally got it to settle down after forcing it to do 4K30 HDR.I'm not sure if the length of 25 feet has anything to do with it, but if you are expecting 4K60 HDR with the 25feet cables, look elsewhere.

I was confident but a little skeptical... but this is INCREDIBLE. And for like $7, it’s better quality (cable) and works just as good as many you’ll find at the store for 3x+ as much! Cables can be such a rip off.... just trust yourself on this one

I tried so many cables to get 4.2.2 on my Apple 4K tv to work - Monoprice, Folsom and on on on.  None of them worked. Apple TV would revert back to 4.2.0. I read the posts of my fellow buyers and ordered this cable and boom the 4.2.2 works. Maybe the cable knew that Jeff Bezos would be very upset if it didn’t work (lol). Recommend this cable. Thick and a bit tough to get 4 or 5 of these cables to go thru the backwalls of my fireplace. If amazon can make these cables thinner. They have a winner.

Why pay more for an HDMI cable when these are available?  They are well made, the connectors aren't too big, and should hold up for a while.  Purchased 3 and they're all functioning as expected with no issues.

No issues whatsoever, picture and audio is flawless, and these are wildly affordable. Anyone remember the early days when Monster sold $100 HDMI cables? Lol. We've come a long way, these are just as good.

I have bought several Amazon HDMI cables of varying lengths.  I have never had a bad cable from Amazon and these performed exactly as expected.  The quality of sound and picture are outstanding.  I highly recommend this item.

I needed this to setup a projector on the other side of the room from my computer. Works fantastic and for the price was MUCH better than trying to re-arrange my room so I could have movie night.Highly recommend.

Works like a charm! I use at Mini Display Adapter and this HDMI cable to get the picture from my 2008 MacBook to my TV and it works great! Came super fast and is exactly what I ordered. Fun fact: if you have a 2009 or older MacBook, the audio can’t go to the TV, however, if you have a Bluetooth Speaker, let their be sound!

Despite being advertised as supporting 4k @ 60Hz, connecting my new Intel 7th gen NUC computer (HDMI 2.0) to my LG OLED TV (HDMI 2.0) caused blank screen/ audio dropouts every few seconds. This occurred for both the cables in the twin pack across all 4 TV HDMI input ports, suggesting a physical design shortcoming rather than an isolated quality problem.  Replacing this cable with the one that came with my PS4 Pro resolved the problem.In summary, works fine for connecting lower resolution/lower refresh rate devices (computer 4k @ 30Hz or 1080p @ 60Hz), but doesn't cut it for ultra high bandwidth HDMI 2.0 connections. Comments such as Oliver T. "And as the highest resolution any 4K TV currently on the market can produce is 3840 x 2160 at 30fps" are inaccurate so watch out - this experience has demonstrated that there is indeed a need to buy more expensive HDMI cables if you want to run at 60fps (60Hz).

We needed to replace the hdmi cable for our direct tv genie box. And I didn't want to deal with direct tv. Figured I would just buy a basic one and hope it's compatible and it was. This did the trick! Yayyy!

What can I say, it works as advertised. Pushing 4k video from my computer with an RX470 to a 43" TCL Roku TV. The video looks great, no glitching or issues at all. Will likely be ordering several more soon.

I bought this to run from my gaming PC with a 1080 gpu and i5 9600k cpu to our 4k tv. Everything is much crisper from the picture to the frames per second. It has helped level out some of the shakyness I got when using old cables I hadSeriously for this price you won't find anything better.

Excellent addition to my bedroom tv setup. One hdmi cable for my new Roku Ultra and 1 for my Blu-ray player. A lot less cable clutter with these 3ft. Cables compared to the 7 ft. Ones I had. Picture and streaming speed is fantastic. Highly recommended!

I just purchased a new 4k LG TV.  The TV came with cables, but would only go to HDMI 1.4.  Stupid I know, and my 4K ROKU box would not display.  I ordered these when I ordered my new TV and was glad I did.  These I installed and all is good.  HDMI 2.2 or higher compatibility.
Didn’t work after a few months. Very disappointing considering it’s a HDMI cable, it really doesn’t have to do much.

Nice to be able to get a high quality but inexpensive cable with the convenience of 2 day delivery.  This is the latest HDMI standard and will be needed if you wish to transfer 4K HDR content.  Note that earlier cables should have no issue with normal 4K content and this cable should only be needed as up 'upgrade' if you are or are planning on using HDR.

I bought this so I could connect my Apple TV to my new TV. I feel it connects perfectly, the picture quality is amazing, and it transfers sound too. I couldn't have asked for a better cable for my needs. And the price could not be beat! Recommend!!!

The HDMI cable is used with my smart TV and works as promised.  The construction of the cable is outstanding and I expect it to last years.  Whenever there is an option to select an AmazonBasics product I will select it based on its quality and cost.  I highly recommend this and the other AmazonBasics products I have selected.

HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable! HDMI Cable!

The Amazon basic high speed HDMI cables are such a great value and the quality is wonderful, very well made. The picture quality is fantastic and it's nice to have the extra length.  I would recommend and would purchase again if needed.
Works great, using the cable to connect a Chrome Book to a TV.My concern is the weight of the cable putting stress on the female connectors on the Chrome Book and the TV.

I bought a three-pack of these ten months ago. All was well...for a while. I started getting strange error messages for one of my inputs. I replaced the cable and the problem was gone. Today, I tried using the Bluray player and got "no signal."  Re-doing the connections didn't help. I replaced this cable and the player is working fine. I tried the Amazon cable on another input and got no signal. So two of the three cables have failed in less than a year. I guess they were not the bargain I thought they were when I bought them. Look elsewhere for better quality!

I received a 3 pack of Amazon basics, ostensibly high speed to replace some older cables. The result? No 4K images from any of my devices. Apple TV revered to 720p, was ok at 1080 HDR, but 4k Dolby Vision was gone. No 4k from my PS4 pro either. I returned them. Every site talks about how great and inexpensive these cables are, but the ones I received were not fit for their purpose.

Does what it needs to do, and the length is long enough so that if I ever wanted to move my computer tower or my PS3 further from their respective monitors, I could easily do so. I keep them both coiled up and strapped, but the wiggle room for the future is nice to have. Thank you AmazonBasics  for making something quality and affordable. So many things use HDMI and I have a feeling I'll be ordering more in the future for hooking up my parent's house.

Works fine, good sturdy cable with solid connectors that make a snug fit into the ports.  This is being used with a new 4k monitor with no problems.  The monitor shipped with a 3' HDMI cable, which is a little silly with a big screen that itself is almost 3' across (LG, I'm looking at you) so I had to buy this 6' length separately.

The package arrived on time and the package came in its own envelope like it could have been shipped separately. The ends were covered with small plastic covers which I appreciated so that I knew that the cable was protected. I think that the conduction in gold tips are supposed to be better than the silver tips. I was originally concerned that at such a small price the cable would be too thin or shorter than described. The cord is decently thick and it really is long enough to go from the floor to the television. I just couldn't imagine my life without it.
Works as it is supposed to and is of a comparable material and construction quality as most other HDMIs in it's relative price range. Go for it!

I've bought a lot of HDMI cables in the past few years, and though they are among the cheapest, I'd say these are probably the best ones I've purchased. They're durable, and reliable. I've never had any issues with them. Highly recommended for gamers like myself and movie buffs like myself as well. Still have my original set, and have only needed to purchase more for additional tvs or when I lose one.

Works as expected to connect a TV to a HDMI Switch box. I looked specifically for an all black cord as many have colors right at the ends and that would have been visible and eye catching and the HDMI Switch sits on the TV stand.
Super thick. If you have a tight squeeze or sharp corner, this may not be for you. It works great.

I finally updated my PC and needed HDMI cables for the monitors.  These are long enough and have a good price.  The images on my monitors are better than when I was using VGA & DVI cables.  A good buy for me.

Works great! Such a great deal for the price! Using it to extend the range of my HTC Vive box, and for those of you hoping to use it for this purpose, it does work. However, it required me to update my GTX 1070 to the newest January 2018 update. I have heard that people tend to have more consistent compatibility with the 15 foot version of this cable (though I have not tried it myself).

Great cables that we are using on our new Apple 4K TV 64 model that we purchased on Amazon. One of the reasons I like buying stuff on Amazon even if Best Buy will match their price is the extended warranty seems to be much cheaper. These HDMI cables are pretty much all the same as long as they are certified to be what they claim to be (like a 3rd gen cable, etc...).

For the price of these cables, you can't go wrong.  They work perfectly and they are WAY cheaper than any HDMI cables you can get for retail.  The multi packs offer an even better deal, too.  If you think you may need more, spend a little extra and get a multi pack.  Why spend more for HDMI cables when you don't have to?
This is one heck of a nice cable!  Quite a large cable diameter that works well on TV stand on casters ("roll about").  Used with cable tie strain relief so HDMI jacks on equipment aren't damaged.
Ironic that my HDMI cord with the thicker cable ceased working to feed Comcast's signal from the Cable box to my smart TV.  This Amazon basics product, while thinner and lighter works perfectly...

This cable seems to weaken the signal quite a lot. I don't think this is a problem specific to this cable and probably applies to all long HDMI cables, so I'm still giving it three stars. Adding an HDMI splitter (which provides a small amount of amplification) inline with the cable near the source seems to help.
We have been migrating to newer ports like DP, MDP and HDMI from VGA and DVI so I needed one when upgrading my wife’s monitor.  NIce to have a few spares in case we upgrade computers or monitors.

I did not have a three pack of HDMI's I had one cable that I ordered at the time I ordered the Fire Box.  It did not work.  I went to a local store and purchased one that did work.  I was not required to return it to Amazon so it was disposed of with my local recycling group.

One star as it does not work well with Apple 4K TV. The cable causes the Apple TV to lag, Remote lag, and video cuts in and out. This is my second cable within six months. Will not be buying again.  Amazon should fix this problem as many people have the same issue.

This is extremely thick, heavy, shielded cable, about 3/8in(!) diameter.  I'm sure this means good things for its ability to resist hostile (EM-noisy) environments, but as a practical consqeuence you very probably will want some right-angle adapters; this stuff is capable of exerting quite a lot of leverage on a port if you leave it to its own devices. I strongly doubt you'll find better-quality cable at anything approaching this price.
My monitor started going black for a few seconds. After checking the usual settings, driver updates, different ports, and so on, I tried a new cable and that fixed it.

Didn't know what HDMI cords did before, I feel really stupid.  My screen looks amazing now, when before this older TV I have didn't look very clear.  It was fuzzy and the image seemed too big in places.  With this cord now I have sharp clear pictures, which is awesome especially for gaming.

Pic cuts out on 2/3 cables at 4k HDR. Took me 3 days to diagnose because tv was brand new along with cables...all installed at same time. Very frustrating. On top of that, now I have to go out of my way to return them. Huge inconvenience. I'll never buy Amazon Basic crap again.

Great quality HDMI cable.Don't waste your money on expensive HDMI cables that claim to have better performance. Digital signals either work or they don't and the quality of the cable will not determine picture quality or audio quality.
I was real skeptical after purchasing these for ROKU ULTRA and my antiquated 1080p 40 inch sony tv.I am a tinker at heart and an engineer by profession

I bought a roku for my new 4k hdr tv, the reason is for a specific app but that is another story....anyhow while at Best Buy the salesman sold me the cheapest cable he had to transmit 4K hdr.  So I went home looked these up and bought them.  What is ironic is the $30 3ft cable would not pass the signal but when I hooked these up I got everything to 4K hdr 60fps and 2.2-see attached photo-sorry couldn't attach photo .  Trust me these are the real deal!!

Got 2 in late June of 2020 — should've tested them both more thoroughly while I was still within the return window. As of sometime in August the signal cuts out every few minutes with one of the cables. Other one seems to work fine as of now. I'd recommend paying a little more for your HDMI cable.

EDIT: failed after a little over one yearSeriously it is so thick, easily the thickest cable I own. Thicker than any power cord in my house, including the fridge and a 100ft extension cable. Its about the same size as the hose from my air compressor.
I don't  think that this is a high-speed cable as my Sony Bravia TV and amplifier can not communicate through the Audio Return Channel (ARC), which demands a high-speed HDMI cable.

The description says that these cables can do 4k@60Hz, but that's not the case for me. One of them works at 2560x1440, the second one manages 2048x1152, but any higher than that, and the picture drops out or has horrible noise, making the screen unusable. Other cables work fine for me in the same monitor and computer, just these don't. I'm disappointed, but I guess you get what you pay for.

I gave this 3 stars as I purchased it for a Fire tv cube and it was not compatible with the cube. It worked fine with our PS4, but i find it rather ironic that 2 Amazon products were incompatible. Not the quality I am accustomed to from Amazon.
I've had this HDMI cable since Aug 2018, it's been plugged into my LED TV and it's working great for me.  For the price I couldn't beat it.  I would buy this item again if and when I need another.

This is a very high quality HDMI cable at an excellent price. I am an tenacious researcher and usually scour the Internet for recommendations from sources I trust. The AmazonBasics brand came up very high in the rankings, sometimes in #1 place, especially for the combination of quality and price. For a moment I panicked, thinking that I had ordered the wrong cable, as it did not slide easily into the HDMI slot on the side of my older flat screen (no issues on the back of the set). It appeared too fat, but with patience I wiggled it in and it fits fine. I'll definitely look at AmazonBasics first next time.
This cable is HEAVY DUTY.The power cables coming into my home from the electric pole out front aren't as thick as these.

I have Dish network, and I upgraded to the Hopper3. The Dish technician tried to sell me a new cable that can handle the speeds required by 4K HDMI signals. I thought, I don't have a 4K TV, so I don't need their new cable. Not to mention they had 3 different grades of cables priced from 40 to 100 bucks. After he left my TV began having ghost issues. It would happen, and then clear up. I then tried this high speed cable from AmazonBasics, no more issues. Thanks AmazonBasics. Going to buy more of these cables.

I read an article that said all HDMI cables are the same....I just got a new FireTv for my 4k tv and the quality was really choppy.  I thought the FireTv might be junk and I thought of replacing the crappy $.99 store hdmi cables I had.  I did and it solved my problems.  No more lag, no jumpy or choppy screen.  My old cables didn't have a problem with 1080p, but 4k would give it hell and these cables solved my problem.

Used to connect basic TV so not a high end home theater setup. I personally can't see any issues on image quality and build of cable seems higher end then expecting for the cost. Probably wouldn't use in a high end theater system but would certainly use for any other TV setup.I would purchase again.

I bought this cable for my mom, who has some strange gripe against watching Netflix on her laptop. This was the only cable that seemed to be both quality and cheap, so I decided to give it a go.It works far better than I expected for this price! It does everything that I wanted, the cable is durable and it's long enough for my needs.

Very long cord for my needs (in car) it fits in both outlets but I wasn't able to use because if there was any bumps or movement the picture stopped. May work just fine if used in stationary environment

Great cable for the money.  I got the 2 pack.  One for my Blu-ray player and one for my Apple fourth generation TV. The cable is constructed well, feels very durable and works as advertised. I can’t imagine a more expensive cable would do any better than these cables. I recommend these Amazon basics cable

The overall finish of the cable appears sturdy and lasting, and more importantly, it does the job that it's supposed to do. I will only advise that you pay attention to the lengths to determine which one best suits your purposes. Too long and it may get too unwieldy and messy, too short and it may not meet your needs.

What AmazonBasics is all about.  You need an HDMI cable of a specific length.  You could care less about the color, you just want it to work.  It's on Amazon.  Buy it in one click vs rummaging through probably multiple stores looking for the physical object that they probably don't have, and if they do it's at least twice the cost.  Thank you Amazon for simplifying my life!
Great cable, convenient length and great value!

Worked well for the first five months but by month six was failing. Picture flickers regardless of which device and which tv is used. With other options at this same price point, I would try a different brand next time.

This is a great value. The cables are just as good quality as any other higher priced cable. No need to spend an more money. Works great between my receiver and tv. Have it running 4k and HDR through my xbox one x with zero issues. Also works just fine with my ARC input.
Great product. Great price. Hooked these up from a new 4K television to a wireless AT&T cable box, an X Box One X, and a 4K Apple TV. All content in 4K (HDR, Dolby Vision) where applicable.

This cable will not allow me to extend displays across a 4K laptop screen and Dell 3840x1600 monitor. It will allow one or the other to be used (or both duplicated, which is useless). Other high-speed HDMI cables that I have will allow the displays to be extended, i.e. as soon as I connect a different cable I can view both screens as one desktop, so this is an issue with this cable specifically. If you need to drive roughly two 4K displays, don't buy this cable.

A perfectly capable replacement for a cable given to someone I love very much who needed a cable like this. They needed it for a foreign language satellite receiver, it was connected to my ROKU. My loved one watched her Asian broadcast and I went to Amazon and looked for a new video cable at a great price. I hooked it up and resumed my viewing a day or two later. Works good like a cable should.
